Ayssi comensan las paraulas de Albucasim .	Thus begin the words of Avicenna.
O, filhs, pus yeu he a vos complit aquest libre, le qual es le derier de la sciencia de medicina, per le compliment de lu so consequit la fi en lu, e per las exposicios de lu, e per las declaracios de lu, es a mi vist que yeu complesca aquel a vos am aquest tractat, le qual es partida de la operacio am ma, so es cyrurgia.	Oh, my sons, when you have completed this book, which is the last of medical science, through the fulfillment of its purpose it has come to an end, and through its explanations, and through its declarations, I believe you will find great satisfaction in this treatise, which is a part of the most important operation, namely, surgery.
Quar la operacio am ma es prostrada en nostre regio e en nostre temps de tot privada, entro que fort leu peric la sciencia de lu, e le vistigi de lu es ostat; e no romasero de lu sino alcunas petitas descripcios en les libres dels Antics, les quals mudero las mas e endevenc ad aquels error e heyssitacio entro que son clausas las entencios de lu e es elonguada la forsa de lu e l’art.	For surgery, considered the most important operation in our region and in our time, is shrouded in great secrecy, as knowledge of it has declined and only a few brief descriptions can be found in the books of the Ancients, which have led to the development of many errors and misconceptions, as the understanding of its principles is closed, and its power and art are obscured.
E es vist a mi que yeu vivifique aquela am ordenacio de aquest tractat en aquela segon la via de exposicio e de declaracio e de abreviacio; e per que vengua am las formas dels ferramentz de cautheri e dels autres instrumentz de la obra cum sia per addicio de la declaracio, e per preparacio de lu, la qual causa es necessaria.	And I have found it necessary to revive the order of this treatise through a second method of exposition and declaration and abbreviation; and in order to include illustrations of cautery tools and other surgical instruments used for the work, as an addition to the explanations, and preparation, which is essential.
Mays la causa per la qual no es atrobat bo artifex am la sieua ma en aquest nostre temps, es quar la art de medicina es longua, e que cove le sieu actor denant aquo esser excercitat en la sciencia de anotomia la qual recontec Gualia entro que sapia les juvament dels membres e las formas de aquels, e la conjunctio e la separacio de lor; e haia la conoyssensa dels osses, dels nervis e dels lacertz, e·l nombre de aquels, e la egrecio de lor; e de las venas pulsatils e de las quietas, e dels locs del eyssiment de lor.	But the cause why our artful physician does not employ his hand as he should in our time is that the art of medicine is long and requires expertise in anatomy to understand the growth of members and their shapes, the union and separation of them, the knowledge of bones, nerves, and cartilage, and the names of these, and the extraction of them; also of pulsing veins and static ones, and the places of their emission.
E per aquo ditz Ypocras que am u nom es mot, mays en l’obra petit, e majorment en la art de la ma.	And for this reason Hippocrates says that the name is misleading, but in practice it is small, especially in the art of healing.
Mays nos ja avem dit de aquel en l’introit de aquest libre; quar qui no es scient aquo que li avem dit de anotomia, no es evacuat que no caia en error per la qual siran mortz les homes, ayssi cum yeu he vist trops de aquels, quar alscus son formatz en esta sciencia e gettan se de aquela ses sciencia e ses experiment.	We have already spoken of this in the introduction to this book; for those who are ignorant of what we have said about anatomy, it is not to be wondered that they fall into errors from which men may die, as you have seen many such people formed in this science but lacking in true knowledge and experience.
Quar yeu vi un metge folh e enperit aver incidit un apostema escrophilos en le colh de una femna, e incidic alcunas arterias del colh per que fluic gran sanc entro que la femna cazec morta entre las mas de lu.	You see a foolish doctor who has cut an infected ulcer on the thigh of a woman and cut some arteries in her thigh so that much blood flows inside, causing the woman to die between his hands.
E vi un autre metge que pres que el traguera una peyra d’un home le qual avia procesit en sa etat, e la peyra era gran, e venguet a lu e trayssec aquela peyra am un tros de la vesiqua, per que aquel home al tertz dia es mort.	And you see another doctor who put his tongue in the mouth of a man who had been biting his teeth, and the tooth was large, and he managed to pull it out with a piece of the jawbone, so that man died on the third day.
E yeu ja apelat fuy a estrayre aquela, e vi que per la grandesa de la peyra e per la disposicio del malaute conogui subre lu que morira.	And you have already urgently extracted it, and you see that due to the size of the tooth and the state of the patient, you know that he will die.
E vi un autre metge le qual prenia stipendic de un duc de nostra terra per cyrurgia, e endeven a un crastrat negre le qual era deves lu fractura en la coyssa de lu; e perparec le metge am la sua ignorancia, estrayssec la fractura, sobre la plagua, am pulvinas e astelas am forta strectura, e no layssec a la plagua espiracio.	And you see another doctor who was hired by a duke from our land for surgery, and he operated on a black castrated man whose thigh had a fracture; due to the doctor's ignorance, he removed the fracture, over the wound, with saws and nails with strong tension, and did not allow the wound to breathe.
E aprop le desliet segons los sieus desiriers, e aprop le relieg, e aprop le leyssec per alcus jorns e comandec que nos deslies le liament; e estec ayssi entro que la coyssa e·l pe foro apostematz, e pervenguet a perdicio.	And then, according to their desires, release the tension, relax the muscles, and rest for some days, and command that we loosen the ligament; in this way, too, if the matter is in the feet or the legs, it will heal completely and be cured.
E yeu fuy apelat a lu, e aparelhegui a desliar le liament, e conseguida es tranquilitat e enayssi amermet de sas dolors.	And so, having called upon it and prepared to loosen the ligament, peace is achieved and thus, their pain disappears.
Mays empero ja corrupcio era confermada en le membre, per que no pogui refrenar aquela, e no cessec perambular la corrupcio en le membre entro que·l malaute peric.	However, if the corruption is confirmed in the member and it cannot be restrained, the corruption will continue to spread throughout the member until it reaches a dangerous state of illness.
E vi un autre metge le qual perforec un apostema cancros, e fo ulcerat aprop alscus dias, entro que foc magnificada la malicia de lu am lo senhor de lu.	And there is another doctor who perforates a cancerous ulcer, which festers for some days until the malignancy of it grows stronger under its lordship.
La qual causa es quar le cranc caut es pur de humor melencolic, lahoras no cove que pervengua a lu am ferr de tot, sino que sia an membre le qual suffertes que de tot fos hostat.	Which causes is because the crust of the ulcer is pure melancholy humor; it does not cover that it will reach him through all means, but rather should be in the member which suffers that it should entirely be consumed.
E per aquo, filhs, necessari es a vos que la operacio am ma sia devisada en dos devesios: so es en operacio a lu qual es associada salut, e en obra am la qual es perilh en las majors disposicios.	And therefore, sons, it is necessary for you that the operation should be divided into two parts: one is in an operation associated with health, and the other in a deed which is perilous to major dispositions.
E yeu ja he exsitat aquo en tot loc de aquest libre en le qual venc opperacio en la qual es error e temor; per que necessari es a vos que guardetz aquo e layssetz aquel, per que les folhs no atrobo via a parlar e a vos desonestar.	And you have already encountered this in every place in this book where operations are spoken of with error and fear; therefore, it is necessary for you to guard these things and lay down those, so that the ignorant do not take them as a path to speak and slander you.
E donc prenetz las vostras armas am sollicitut e am proteccio de Dieu , e les vostres malautes am falicitat e am fermetat.	And therefore, take up your weapons with diligence and the protection of God, and your patients with ease and firmness.
E usatz de la milhor via per la gracia de Dieu perdusent a salut e a lausabla successio, e laysatz las malautias terriblas de difficil sanacio, e ostatz las vostras armas de aquo que vos fa temer, per so que ysitatio en vostra fe e en le vostre nom no vos evasisca: quar mays es remanent a la vostra gloria, e pus aut en le mon e en derier a las vostras sanctitatz.	And use the best way for the grace of God, leading to salvation and glorious success, leave behind terrible illnesses with difficult healing, and set down your weapons of what makes you afraid, so that despair in your faith and in your name does not escape you: for more remains for your glory, and also for the honor of God and after your sanctity.
Gualia ja diyssec en alcunas sieuas monicios:	Cut open some of their wounds:
“No mediquetz malautia mala, per so que mals metges no siatz nompnatz”.	Do not treat bad ailments with bad medicines, so that bad doctors do not become famous.
E yeu ja he devesit aquest libre segontz tres capitols.	And you have already divided this book into three chapters.
Comensa la divisio del libre, e primier de la primieyra partida.	Begin the division of the book, and first, the first part.
Le primier capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, en las formas dels instrumentz e en les ferrementz dels cauteris, e de aquo que necessari es en la opperacio.	The first chapter arranged deals with the feet, in the forms of instruments and the tools of cautery, and anything else that is necessary for the operation.
La divisio de la segonda partida.	The division of the second part.
Le segon capitol, de siccio e perforacio, e de ventosas, e de plaguas, e de extractio de sagetas e de semblantz ad aquelas, tot capitolat e ordenat de las formas dels instrumentz.	The second chapter deals with incision and piercing, and also with cupping glasses, plaisters, and the extraction of arrows and similar objects, all described in detail regarding the forms of the instruments.
Divisio de la tersa partida.	Division of the third part.
Le tertz capitol, de restauracio e de dislocacio, e de curacio de torcio e de semblantz ad aquels; capitol ordenat del cap entro·s pes, e de las formas dels instrumentz.	The third chapter, on restoration and dislocation, and on the treatment of twists and similar conditions; a chapter arranged on internal foot anatomy and the forms of instruments.
De cauteri am foc e am medicina aguda e rememoracio de la opperacio.	On cautery with fire and acute medicine, and the remembrance of operation.
Am aquel comensa le tractat de tot le libre.	At that point begins the treatment of the entire book.
Cove que yeu digua la qualitat dels juvamentz de aquel cauteri e dels noccumentz de lu, e en qual compleccio sia prohibit cauteri.	Understand what I have said about the quality of the youth of that cautery and the documents of it, and in what condition cautery is prohibited.
Donc dic que·l sermo de la qualitat del juvament de cauteri e del noccument de lu es sermo lonc e prolixs, e subtil per sciensa, e secret amaguat; e ja de lu a parlat gran multitut de savis, e de lu se son desacordatz, et a mi abasta un petit dels sermons de lor, temen perlonguacio.	Therefore, it says that the discourse on the quality of cautery's youth and the documents of it is long and prolix, subtle for knowledge, and secrets concealed; and already many savants have spoken of them, and there are disagreements among them, and I will content myself with a small part of their discourses, fearing prolongation.
E donc dic que cauteri comfereys a tota compleccio universalment la qual es am materia o ses materia, exceptat dos compleccios, las quals son compleccios caudas ses materia .	And therefore it is said that cautery will relieve every general connection universally, which is of matter or its matter, excepting two connections, which are connections with their own matter.
En la compleccio cauda e secca am materia se desecordero; quar alcus dyssero que cauteri es juvatiu ad aquela, e les autres dyssero le contrari de aquel, que cauteri no es convenient en malautia la qual es per qualiditat e per siccitat, quar natura del foc es qualiditat e siccitat, e enconvenient es que malautia cauda e secca am aquo que es caut e sec sia sanada.	In the connection that is dry and hard with matter, it becomes disordered; for some say that cautery is helpful to such, while others say the contrary, that cautery is not appropriate in illness caused by dryness and hardness, because the nature of fire is quality and dryness, and it would be inappropriate to treat an illness that is dry and hard with a moist and hot medicine.
E diysec aquel que ditz le contrari de aquel, que per cauteri es fayt juvament en tota malautia cauda e secca que ve en les cors dels homes, quar quan tu comparas le cors de home e las humiditatz de lu a la compleccio del foc, atrobas le cors de home freg.	And those who say the contrary state that cautery is beneficial in all dry and hard illnesses that are found in human bodies, because when you compare the human body and its humidity to the connection of fire, you find the body to be harsh.
E yeu dic per le sermo de aquel, que esperiment aquo ja a mi alscunas vetz a descubert.	And he says, based on the argument of those who hold this view, that he has already discovered this through experience several times.
Mays empero no cove que vengua sobre aquo aquel que ja es exproat e excersitat en le capitol de cauteri per derier exercici, e a conogut la diversitat de la compleccio dels homes e la disposicio de las malautias en lor meteyssas, e las causas de aquelas, e·ls accidentz de lor, e l’espasi del temps de aquelas.	However, it is not appropriate that anyone who has already been trained and practiced in the art of cautery on various parts of the body, who knows the diversity of the composition of humans, the disposition of illnesses within them, the causes of those illnesses, and the circumstances of their occurrence, as well as the passage of time, should come to this.
Mays en las autras compleccios, no es sobre vos temor, e majorment en las malautias fregas e humidas, quar ja totz les metges se son acordatz sobre aquels, e no so desecordatz en le juvament am cauteri en aquelas.	In other cases, there is no cause for fear, especially with dry and hot illnesses, as all doctors are in agreement about these, and they do not disagree on the use of cautery to treat them.
E sapiatz, filhs, que del secret de curacio per cauteri am foc e de la bontat de lu, so sobre cauteri am medicina comburent, es quar le foc es simple, la accio del qual no perven sino al membre le qual es cauterizat e no notz al autre membre am lu ajustat sino am petit nocument.	And know, my children, that the secret of healing by cautery with fire and the goodness of it, are superior to medical cauterization, because fire is simple, its action only affects the member being cauterized, without causing pain to other members with its proximity, except for a slight discomfort.
Mays la accio de medicina comburent perven ad aquel en les membres le qual de lu alunhat, e fort leu fa venir en le membre malautia de dificil sanacio e fort leu ausit.	The action of medicinal cauterization, however, affects distant members and can severely disrupt the healing of a member suffering from a difficult-to-cure illness, and it offers strong aid.
Mays le foc, per la sua sublimitat e de la sua substancia bontat, no fa aquo sino que superfluisca E ja es a nos conogut per experiment e per longitut de servitut de studi am l’art sobre le veritat de las causas; e per aquo yeu so excusat de la longitut del sermo E si no fos que no es legut al mieu libre en aquest pausero a vos secret amaguat am le foc, e la qualitat de la operacio de lu en les cors e de la sieua expulcio per la qual expellis las malautias, am sermo philosophic demostratiu, le qual siria acuit en las vostras pessas.	Kindle the fire, for its subtlety and the goodness of its substance, does not harm, but only surpasses. It is already known to us through experience and the longevity of studying the art regarding the truth of causes; and for this reason, I excuse the length of my speech. If it were not that I do not wish to reveal the secret fire to you in this brief moment, I would speak at length about its nature in the body and the quality of its operation in expelling illnesses, demonstrated through philosophical discourse, which would be sharpened in your minds.
E sapiatz, filhs, que els se desacordan del temps en le qual es convenient far cauteri e pausan le milhor temps de primaveyra.	And know, sons, that the times of disagreements regarding when to perform cautery and place pads are during the time of spring.
E yeu dic que cauteri es convenient en tot temps, per so que le nocument per le temps accident es submergit en le juvament de aquo que am le cauteri es atirat, e majorment si le cauteri es per dolors o de dolors necessaries, fortz e fistinas, las quals no suffertan tarditat per so que es temut de aquelas que vengua malicia, que es major que petit nocument entrant per lo temps.	And you say that cauterization is convenient at all times, so that the harm caused by the passage of time is overcome by the healing properties of cautery, and even more so when cautery is for pains or necessary pains, severe and acute, which do not suffer from delay, because it is feared those that come with malice, which is better than allowing further harm to enter over time.
E aysso no catz en vostras pessas, o, filhs, aquo no estiman sino le poble vulguar e les fols metges, so es que ad aquela malautia que es sanada per cauteri no es redicio tot temps, e pausan aquel consequen.	And thus, do not rest in your feet, oh sons, for it is only the common people and foolish doctors who cherish such a malady that is cured by cautery; it does not completely disappear, and those consequences persist.
E la causa no es ges ayssi quo els cuydan per aquo, quar cauteri no es sino en loc de medicina la qual altera la compleccio e esicca las humiditatz las quals son causa per que veno las dolors.	And the cause is not thus as they believe, for cautery is merely a place of medicine that alters the composition and dries up the humors which are the cause of the pain.
Mays empero cauteri superflueys sobre la medicina per volicitat de la sua valitut e vertut de la sua operacio e grandesa del sieu senhor.	Yet doctors may use cautery superfluously over medicine due to the desire for its effectiveness and the power of its operation and the greatness of their lord.
E es possible que la sua malautia retorne en alcuna hora del temps, segon la compleccio del malaute e la locacio de la sua malautia, e la vertut de lu, e aquo que es preparat en le cors de lu de la agreguacio de las superfluitatz en lu, e aquo que es pervengut a lu en la sua acquisicio en viandas e semblantz de aquelas causas; sino que la malautia en la qual sia aministrat cauteri sia malautia subtil en membre de paucas superfluitatz e humiditatz, ayssi cum cauteri de dent per dolor e semblantz ad aquel, possible es que en lu no retorne aquela dolor, mays aquo se fa en petitz.	And it is possible that their illness may return at some time in the future, according to the complexity of the illness and the location of their malady, and the effectiveness of it, and what has been prepared within them from the addition of excesses within them, and what has come upon them from their intake of food and similar causes; but the illness on which cautery is administered, if it be a subtle illness in members with few excesses and humors, just as with a tooth cautery for pain and similar conditions, it is possible that that pain may not return in them, but this is done in small doses.
E mays sermo vulgar es que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, e es sermo dreyturier, no ad aquo que els entendo en lu, quar els crezo que no es curacio que aprofieyta am medicina ni am autra causa aprop cauteri.	And it is commonly said in popular speech that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine, and it is right speech, not to those who do not understand it, for they believe that it is no cure that profits from medicine or any other cause except cautery.
E la causa es en contrari de aquo; e la entencio que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina no es sino quan administram las manieyras de curacio en alcunas malautias, e aquelas medicinas no conferieysso, e aprop en la fi de la causa aministra hom cauteri, e aprofieyta ad aquela.	And the reason is to the contrary; and I understand that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine not to be when we apply the methods of healing in some illnesses, and those medicines do not help, and then at the end of the cause, we administer a cautery, and it profits from that.
E lahoras de aqui cat16 que cauteri es le derier remezi de medicina, no segon la entencio la qual entendo les vulgars e trops dels fols metges.	And from here it follows that a cautery is the last remedy of medicine, not according to the understanding of popular people and too many foolish doctors.
E diyssero les antics que cauteri am aur es milhor que cauteri am ferr, e no diyssero aquo sino per la equalitat del aur e sublimitat de la sua sustancia.	And they said that a gold cautery is better than an iron cautery, and they did not say this except because of the equality of gold and the subtlety of its substance.
E diyssero que le loc de cauteri no fa brac, cum aquo no sia absolutament vertat, quar yeu ja he aquo proat e he atrobat que aquel no fa aquo sino en alcus cors ses les autres, e cauteri am aquel es bo e milhor que am ferr ayssi quo els diyssero; mays empero quan tu fas cauteri am foc am de aur, no es a tu declarat, quar es egnit segon la quantitat que tu vols per la rugor de l’aur, e quar prepara a recebre freg; e si ajustas sobre lu ignicio se fon l’aur per le foc, e caso en le foc alcunas laminas per que le artifex catz per la occupacio de aquel.	And they say that the place of cautery does not burn unless it is absolutely true, for you have already seen and experienced that it only does so in certain bodies, and cauterization on that part is good and better than as they said; nevertheless, when you make a cautery with fire from gold, it is not declared to you, for the gold is consumed according to the amount you want due to the heat of the fire, and if you hold it over the flame, the gold melts into the fire, and some sheets fall into the fire so that the craftsman can catch them because of the occupation with that.
E per aquo es fayt cauteri am ferr deves nos pus leugerament e pus propdanament a rectitut de operacio.	And for that, cauterization with iron must be done more lightly and more precisely to ensure the correctness of the operation.
E yeu ja he ordenat aquest capitol en le cauteri segon capitols, et he ordenat aquels del cap entro les pes, per so que aleugo le demandant aquo que vol de lu.	And you have already organized this chapter on cauterization according to chapters, and have ordered those from the head down to the feet, so that I am now asking him what he wants from it.
De cauteri de dolor de cap per frigiditat e humiditat.	With a pointed cautery for head pain caused by cold and humidity.
Le capitol primier.	**First Chapter**
Aquesta cauterizacio confereys a la humiditat e frigiditat sobre le servel accident de la qual so doas causas, so es causa de soda e multitut de flux raumatic, apelat corissa, del cap a las partidas dels huelhs e de las aurelhas fluent, e multitut de dormir, e de dolor de dentz e del guolayro, e universalment de tota malautia que ve per fregiditat, ayssi cum paraliticament, sodo e apoplexio, e semblantz en aquelas malautias.	This cauterization confers a benefit upon the affected area suffering from humidity and cold, which are two causes of severe and numerous rheumatic fluxes, called corissa, affecting the head, the parts of the senses (eyes and ears), and also sleep, toothache, and throat pain, as well as any illness that arises from cold, similarly to paralysis, apoplexy, and similar conditions in those illnesses.
La forma de aquesta cauterizacio es aquesta, que primieyrament comandes al malaute que sia evacuat am medicina lacsativa le cap mondificant, per tres o per quatre nueytz, segon que exhigeys la vertut del malaute e la edat de lu e la sua costuma.	The method of this cauterization is as follows: first, command the illness to be evacuated using a laxative on the head, for three or four nights, depending on the severity of the illness, the age of the patient, and their usual condition.
E aprop comanda li que raza le sieu cap am razor, e aprop fay aquel sezer entre las tuas mas sobre una banca cayrada e que pause las suas mas sobre le pietz sieu.	And then he commands them to shave their head, and prepares the surgical instrument between your legs on a clean bench, and places his hands on the patient's feet.
E aprop pausa la razit de la tua palma aprop le pous sobre la razit del nas entre les huels sieus.	Then he places the razor on the sole of your foot, between your toes.
Mays empero, cum le tieu dit del mieg loc es pervengut, signa aquel loc am tenta, e aprop igneys le cauteri olivar del qual aquesta es la forma:	However, if the affected area is in the middle of the foot, mark that place with a try, and then apply the olive-shaped pointed cautery to it.
E aprop pausa aquel sobre le loc senhat am tenta, a manieyra que descent, am la qual la tieua ma sia constrengida petit a petit, e tu revolveys aquel.	And then he places that on the healthy area marked with a try, in such a way that it descends, causing the patient's hand to be gradually restricted, and you turn it.
E aprop leva la tua ma leugerament e reguarda le loc, e si veses ja del os esser descubert alcuna quantitat del cap, ayssi cum la quantitat de gra de errs, lahoras eleva la tua ma, e si no torno la tua ma am aquel ferr, am autre de aquel, si es enfrigidat, entro que sia vist del os aquo que yeu he dit a tu.	Then he gently lifts his hand and examines the area, and if you see that the bone is already exposed, along with some amount of pus, he raises his hand again, and if the instrument is not cold, he returns it to that or another place, as I have told you.
E aprop pren un petit de sal e disolveys aquel sobre le loc e leyssa aquel per tres jorns.	And then take a little salt and dissolve it over the area and leave it for three days.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto enbegut en boder e leyssa aquel sobre lu entro que sia destrusida la scara del foc.	Then apply pressure over the infected area at the border, and leave it until the scorch of the fire is destroyed.
E aprop cura le loc am anguent tetrafarmacon entro que sia sanat.	Then treat the area with a four-part remedy until it is healed.
E ja diyssero que quant la plagua roman uberta, tant mielhs geta le brac, per que es milhor e mays juvatiu.	And it is said that when the Roman plague opens, the more easily the wound heals, so it is better and more rejuvenating.
E diyssero alcus de lor que sia cauterizada la codena entro al os, e sia tengut le cauteri entro que sia adhurida alcuna partida de la specitut del os.	And they say that some of them cauterize the bone within the bone, and hold the cautery until some part of the bone's nature is hardened.
E aprop sia ras aquo que es adhust del os, e aprop sia curat.	Then remove whatever is attached to the bone, and then clean it.
E diyssero autres que am lo cauteri pervengua al derier, entro que enprema en le os forta enprecio entro que le os caga, e aquesta es la forma de alphecati petit:	And they say that the cautery should be applied to the rear, first strengthening the bone with great effort as it passes through the bone, and this is the shape of the small knife:
E estiman de aquel loc expiran la vapors del cap.	And they estimate that from that place, the vapours of the head escape.
E sia tenguda la plagua uberta per lonc temps, e aprop sia curada entro que sia consolidada.	And the wound should be kept open for a long time, and it should be treated until it is consolidated.
Mays a mi no so vistas aquestas doas specias de cauteri de tot, sino en alcus homes segon via de temor; e layssa aquel, deves mi, milhor es am salut, quan es; quar le cap es develitat per solucio de continuitat de lu ayssi cum havem testificat en les autres membres, e majorment quan le cap del malaute es de freul natura.	I do not have a clear understanding of these two types of cautery from what I have seen, but according to some people's way of thinking; nevertheless, in my opinion, the best course for health is to follow when it is appropriate; because the head has been exposed through the solution of its continuity as we have witnessed in the other members, and even more so when the nature of the disease is feverish.
E la specia de cauteri primieyra es mays salva e milhor deves mi; e de aquela husi e am aquela obra am salut.	And the specific type of cautery that comes first is most effective and best for me; and from that, to that work, for health.
Capitol segon.	Second chapter.
Del cauteri del cap.	Of the cautery of the head.
Quan en tot le cap accideys dolor cronica e longua e aquo es en le malaute prolonguat, e usa de gerras e de cochias e de capipurges e de emplaustres e de guatz e de cadels e de gualinas e de semblantz, e majorment si ja es cauterizat am un cautere le qual recontam e no aprofieyta a lu deguna de aquelas causas, lahoras considera quar si le cap del malaute es de fort creacio en la sua natura; e no es freul et atroba mot gran freg, lahoras aquel cauterisa am autra cauteri dejos aquel un pauc.	When a chronic and prolonged pain occurs in the entire head and this prolongs the suffering, it is necessary to use blades, hooks, saws, ointments, poultices, salves, cats, dogs, chickens, and similar remedies, and most importantly, if cautery has already been performed with a tool that does not address any of the underlying causes, consider that the strength of the disease lies in the nature of its head; and if there is no significant heat or inflammation, another cautery should be applied to it slightly.
E aprop cauterisa aquel sobre le corn del sieu cap am cauteri entro que la codena es partida.	And then cauterize it over the edge of his head with a cautery, as long as the wound is open.
Incisa la codena e sia descuberta del os la quantitat la qual havem recontat e cauteriza aquel am un cauteri en la partida deriera del cap en le loc le qual es apelat vas, — e es aquel loc en le qual es pausada ventosa.	Cut the wound and expose the amount of bone we have found, and cauterize it with a cautery at the back of the head in the area known as the base, which is where the wind is stopped.
Et alleuja la tua ma en aysso, e no descobras le os, quar le malaute per aquo atroba mot gran dolor diversa de la dolor de totz les autres cauteris del cap.	And apply your hand to it, do not expose the bone, for the disease finds great pain through it, different from the pain of all other cauterizations on the head.
E yeu diyre aquest cauteri en son loc, quar cove que·l cauteri am le qual so cauterisatz les corns del cap e le occiput es pus subtil cauteri que aquel am le qual es cauterisat le mieg loc del cap; e aquesta es la forma de lu.	And you should perform this cauterization in its proper place, because you know that the cauterization which treats the horns of the head and the occipital region is a more subtle cauterization than the one performed on the middle part of the head; and this is the form of it.

De cauterisacio de emigranea no-antiqua.	On the treatment of old migraines.
Quan endeve en la partida del cap dolor sodo, o es stenduda dolor entro al uelh, sia evacuat am medicinas le cap mondificantz, e sia aministrada l’autra curacio, la qual yeu he dita en las devesios de las malautias; e tot no aprofieyta, lahoras cauterisacio en lu es en dos manieyras: o cauterisacio am medicina acuta comburent, o am ferr. Mays cauteri am medicina comburent es que tu prenguas una dolsa de alh, e escorgas aquela e abcindas las extremitatz de lu de amdos les caps.	You may use cautery or burning medicines that you take a hot iron and scorch it, and amputate the ends of them from both heads.
E aprop incideys le loc de la dolor en la templa am una lanceta lada entro que sia en lu feyt loc dejos la codena, entro que sia occultada.	And then you incise the painful area in the temple with a scalpel until it is done, leaving the cord intact, as long as it remains hidden.
E aprop strenh sobre lu am stopada per descent constreccio, e layssa aquel per le spazi de tres horas; e aprop deslia le e tratz le alh, e laysa la plagua per dos o per tres jorn, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto submergit en boder entro que le loc fassa brac.	And then you apply a tight bandage to restrict it by gradual constriction, and leave it for three hours; afterward, you remove the bandage, and place the affected area in cold water for two or three days, and then apply a poultice over it until the pain subsides.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then you apply a cure to it with a poultice until it heals.
E si tu voys, fe aquo am alcunas medicinas comburentz las quals yeu he scriutas en le douse tractat de medicinas comburentz.	And if you find that these methods do not work, consider using some of the burning medicines that I have written about in the two previous treatises on burning medicines.
Mays la cauterisacio am ferr segon aquesta manieyra: igneys per cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	Prepare the cautery according to this manner: take a hot iron whose shape is as follows:
e es apelat claus clavilhs, quar le cap de lu es ayssi cum forma de clavel en le qual es alcuna curvitat, e·n le mieg loc de lu es eminensia petita.	It is called a clave, because its head has the shape of a claw with some curvature, and in the middle part there is a small prominence.
E aprop pausa sobre loc de la dolor, e rete la tua ma — per que no sia adhurida la arceria la qual es dejos — e revol le ferr petit a petit am velocitat.	Then apply pressure on the painful area and hold your hand—to prevent the wound from becoming infected—and slowly turn the iron at a controlled speed.
E si la quantitat de lu que es adhurida per la specitut de la codena ayssi quo la maytat de lu, e elava la tua ma per so que la arteria no sia adhurida la qual es dejos, per so que no vengua flux de sanc.	And if the quantity of blood stuck due to the specific condition of the vein is such that it matches the amount of blood, raise your hand so that the artery below is not affected, preventing any flow of pus.
E aprop enbibeys coto en aygua de sal e pausa aquel sobre le loc, e layssa aquel per tres dias; e aprop pausa coto mulhat am boder, e aprop cura am enguent entro que sia sanat.	Then clean the area with salt water and place a bandage over it, leaving it for three days; apply plenty of ointment around the wound until it is healed.
E si voys, cauterisa am la extremitat del cutellari segon cauteri, e guarda te de incisio de arteria en aquesta emigranea propriament no-antiqua.	And if you see, sharpen the end of the scalpel according to cautery, and be careful not to make an incision into an artery in this newly acquired wound.

De cauterizacio d’emigranea antiqua.	On the cauterization of ancient wounds.
Quan tu curas emigranea am aquo que havem dit de la curacio precedent, e aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias, e no aprofieyta la curacio, e vezes per la malautia que no abasta a lu aquo que havem dit del primier cauteri am medicina o del cauteri am foc, lahoras cove que tu igniscas le cauteri cutellar entro que sia albificat, pus que significas sobre le loc de la dolor am linha de longuesa de la qual sia la maytat del dit, o quays aquel; e depausa la tua ma per una veguada e strenh aquela entro incidiscas la arceria e pervengua entro al os. E yeu vindre am rememoracio del regiment de flux de sanc accident de la arceria segon la sieua manieyra, en le sieu loc de aquest libre.	And you should recall the regulation of the flow of blood from an accidental artery injury according to its manner in this place within this book.

De cauterisacio de las dolors de aurelhas.	On the treatment of ear pain.
Quan en la aurelha ve dolor per freg e es curat am causas lacsativas e am l’autra curacio la qual he dita en la divisio, e no es remauguda la dolor, lahoras igneys le cauteri, e es aquest le qual ha nom puncta, del qual aquesta es la forma:	When ear pain is caused by a foreign body and is treated with cleansing and other remedies as mentioned in the previous sections, and if the pain persists, apply heat with a cautery, which is known as a "puncta," shaped as follows:

De cauterizacio de turtura.	**On the cauterization of tortuous (varicose) veins.**
Turtura la qual es curada e am cauterizacio no es sino de las specias las quals veno per flecma, segon que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias.	The tortuous veins that are cured and treated by cauterization are nothing but the species that come from flux (venous insufficiency), as we have said in the divisions of illnesses.
Esquiva cauterizacio de la specia que endeve per siccacio o per spasme del nervi.	Avoid cauterization of the species that should be treated by drying or spasm of the nerve.
Quan tu curas aquela specia de turtura am jerras e capipurgi e guarguarismes, e no comfereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas le malaute am tres cauteris: la i deves la razit de la aurelha, e·l segon un petit dejos le sieu templar, e le ters deves la conjunccio de doas labias. E pausa lo tieu cauteri per le contrari de la partida malauta, quar mollificacio no ve sino en la partida que apar sana.	And hold your cautery in the opposite direction of the diseased part, for the softening is only seen where the part that appears to be healed begins.
E la forma de cauterisacio es que cauterizas aquel am le cauteri en le dreyt de la extremitat de la aurelha pus sobirana un petit sobre le corn del cap, e en le templar autre, la longuesa del qual sia segon la longitut del dit pous, e depausa la tua ma am cauteri entro que sia comburida la quantitat de la maytat de la specitut de la codena.	The method of cauterization is that you cauterize the affected area with a hot iron directly on the skin, placing it slightly above the affected part of the ear, and on the temple, its length corresponding to the length of the finger, and hold your hand over the cautery until the quantity of the substance of the wound is burned.
E aquesta es la forma del cauteri, e es specia del cutellari, la forma del qual es denant mesa.	This is the form of the cautery, and it is especially from the cutting knife, whose shape is presented in front.
Mays empero pus subtil es que aquel un pauc ayssi co vesas; e cove que cotel en lu de superflua groceza un pauc.	However, it may be even more subtle, as you can see with your own eyes, and take care to avoid any excessive roughness on it.
E aprop cura le loc am aquo que es denant procezit entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of the area that is exposed during the process until it heals.

Capitol .xiiii.	Chapter XIII.
De cauterizacio de fetor de nas.	On cauterization of nasal discharge.

When treating a patient with the condition we have described above and your treatment is not effective, then prepare and make them drink medications for three nights; then shave their head, and cauterize the affected areas with a hot iron cautery or olive oil cautery.
E aprop cauteriza aquel am cauteri clavelh am dos cauteris sobre les dos sobrecilhs dejos les cabels un petit.	And then apply the cautery, striking it twice on both eyelids, leaving a small hair intact.
E guarda te de la arceria que no incindas aquela.	And be careful not to ignite that.
E del cauteri clavilh aquesta es la forma.	And the form of this cautery claw is as follows.
Capitol .xv.	Chapter XV.
De cauteri de mollificacio de palpebras dels huels.	On the mollification of eye lids with cautery.
Quan la palpebra del huel es mollificada per malautia o per humiditat, lahoras cauteriza aquela palpebre1 am un cauteri am aquest cauteri lunar; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	When the eyelid of the eye is softened by disease or moisture, apply a cautery to that eyelid with this lunar cautery; and this is its form:
E si vos, cauteriza aquel sobre les dos sobrecils un petit am dos cauteris en tota partida, e sian elonguatz de las timporas.	And if you, apply the cautery to both eyelids with a small claw in each, extending them from the tempora.
E sia la longitut de quascun cauteri segon la quantitat del sobrecil.	And the length of each cautery should be according to the quantity of the swelling.
E no premas trop la tua ma am le cauteri, mays segon la quantitat que la tersa partida de la palpebre sia adhurida.	And do not press too hard with the cautery, but according to the amount that the third part of the eyelid is adhered.
Capitol .xvi.	Chapter XVI.
De cauteri de la palpebre del huel quan les pels so convertitz a las partidas dedintz e punho le huel.	Regarding the cautery of the eyelid, when the hairs change to the inside parts and press on the eye, apply the cautery to the eyelid.
Quan les pels del huel son convertitz a las partidas dedintz ayssi que pungo le huel, cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, quar cauteri o es am fer o es am medicina comburent.	When the hairs within the eyelid are pressed against it, applying cautery to the eyelid is done in two manners: either by making a cut or by using a medicinal fire.
Si am cauteri de lu am foc, comanda al malaute denant aquo que leyse les sieus pels ayssi cum aquels les quals les mundan, entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz; e si punho aquel deves le lor naysement, lahoras tu strenh les huels de lu am una benda per so que no sia maugut entro que·ls pels sian nascutz.	If you are using fire as cautery, command the patient to open their eyes wide so that all their hairs are exposed, making them long and thin; and if you apply it again later, tighten the eyelids of the patient with a bandage so that the hairs do not grow back.
Donc cum siran nascutz e engualhatz, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop senha sobre la palpebre dels huels de lu am tenta, am senhal le qual sia segon la figura de fulha de merta, e sia le comensament del senhal prop dels pels.	Therefore, when they are clean and washed, place the patient's head on the bed, and gently pull down on the eyelid of their eye, indicating a sign according to the shape of a dead leaf, and it is the beginning of the signal close to the hair.
E aprop pausa coto enbegut en album de huou o en mucillatge de ptilli sobre le huel.	And then apply a cold compress or a thick paste of egg white and herbs to the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu.	And then apply the hot cautery, which has this shape.
E aprop cauteriza sobre la figura la qual as senhada, petit a petit, em motas veguadas, entro que sia comburida la superficia de la codena la qual es ayssi cum fuelha de mirta, tota aparent propriament.	And then cauterize along the indicated figure, little by little, in repeated motions, until the surface of the wound is completely sealed, just as it was with a leaf of myrtle, entirely visible.
E senhal de sanetat de la tieua obra es que tu vegus la palpebre de l’huel ja esser contrayta e·ls pels de lu esser elevatz deves la punctura del huel.	The sign of the patient's recovery is that you see the eyelid of the eye contract and the hairs stand up at the site of the eye's puncture.
E donc eleva la tua ma e laysa aquel per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eredicada la scara.	And so raise your hand and place it there for three days, then apply pressure to the area at the edge until the swelling subsides.
E aprop cura aquela am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then treat that with vinegar until it heals.
Mays si retorna per les pels alcuna causa aprop lor naysement e la palpebra es mollificada, lahoras fay autra vetz le cauteri sobre aquel tot ayssi cum avias fayt primieyrament.	If it returns through the skin for any reason, and the eyelid becomes softened, then do the cautery on that again just as you initially did.
Mays si les pels so en la palpebra dejos, lahoras cauterisa aquela entro que sia elevada al sieu loc natural e sia engualhat e que les pels no punhan le huelh.	If the hairs are in the eyelid, then cauterize it until it is raised to its natural position and healed so that the hairs do not smell bad.
Mays le cauteri am medicina comburent aquest es que comandes al malaute que leyse les pels entro que sian prolonguatz e engualhatz, e aprop sia fayta de carta de drap la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	But the cautery with burning medicines is what you order for the patient to remove the hairs so that they do not grow back and are healed, and then make a leaf-shaped patch from cloth to cover it.
E aprop pren de sabo conogut e de caus viva ana unc. i, o quays aquo, e aprop mescle3 aquelas causas be, e fay aquo am festinacio per so que no sia enfregidat; e aprop expandeys de aquo sobre la carta la qual es fayta ayssi cum forma de fulha de mirtra, e pausa aquel sobre la un huel od amdos; e pausa dejos le huel coto enbegut en album de huou, e el cap del malaute sia en le tieu se.	And then apply soap known for its cleansing properties and a living agent, or something similar, and mix those causes well, making it into a paste so that it is not cooled; and spread this over the paper formed like a myrtle leaf, and place it on one or both wounds; and leave the fragrant edge dipped in egg albumen, and keep the patient's head in a cool place.
E pausa le dit sobre le medicina e prem aquela un petit e no la mauguas entro que lo malaute senta la mordicacio de la medicina, quar mordicacio es en lu ayssi cum de foc.	And then stop talking about the medicine and apply a small amount, not too much, so that the patient does not feel the sting of the medicine, for its sting is like fire.
E donc cum percevera aquo que el atrobo mordicacio, lahoras leyssa la medicina e mau aquela am le tieu dit; donc cum cessa la mordicacio, lahoras remau la medicina he lava le huel am aygua; e lahoras considera si vezes la palpebra ja es levada ayssi cum es lavada deves la costriccio am foc o am incisio, quar lahoras esta be; e si no torna sobre aquela de la medicina sobre le loc en le qual no ha empremut la medicina e no se denigra entro que sia engualhada la tua operacio e sia contrayt le huel.	And so, as you continue to observe the patient's response to the medicine, stop it when the pain from the treatment ceases, and then resume the application of the medicine, washing the wound with water; and consider whether the eyelid has been raised as it should be after being cleaned by fire or an incision, for that is a good sign. If the medicine does not return to the area where it was first applied without causing further irritation, your operation will succeed, and the wound will begin to heal.
E aprop pausa sobre lu coto am boder entro que sia eradicada la codena de la adhustio, e aprop cura aquel am enguent deafinicon o am autre entro que sia sanat.	And then apply pressure to the area until the tension of the adhesion is relieved, and treat it with a healing ointment or other remedies until it is healed.
E es necessari a tu, deves la tua operacio que guardes am pervigil diligencia que en le huel no caia re de la medicina, e si la palpebre aprop alscus dias es mollificada e alcuna causa dels pels punh en le huel, lahoras itera la tua medicina sobre aquel loc le qual de la palpebre es mollificat, e propriamen ayssi quo as fayt al comensament, e aprop enaviro lu entro que sia sanat.	And it is necessary for you, in your operation, to exercise careful vigilance so that no part of the medicine falls out, and if after a few days the eyelid becomes softened due to some cause from the pus in the eye, then apply your medicine again to that place where the eyelid has become softened, and precisely as you did at the beginning, and let it act until it is healed.
E aquesta es la forma de fuelha de mirtra.	And this is the way to make the poultice.
E sapias que les huels dels homes son diversificatz segon la magnitut e la parvitat, e donc segon aquo es fayta la tua contraccio.	And you know that the eyes of men differ in size and shape, and therefore your treatment must be adapted accordingly.
E no sira amaguada la via de rectetut ad aquel al qual es studi en aquesta art.	And let the way of treatment not be hidden from those who study this art.
Capitol .xvii.	Chapter XVII.
De cauterizacio de fistula que es en le lacrimal de l’huel.	On the cauterization of a fistula in the tear duct of the eye.
Quan tu curas fistula am aquo que havem dit en las divisios de las malautias e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquela segon aquesta manieyra: comanda al malaute que pause le cap sieu en le tieu se, e tengua le cap de lu alcun ministre entre las tieuas mas en tal manieyra que no sia maugut ni agitat am le sieu cap.	When you treat a fistula as we have discussed in the sections on diseases and your treatment does not confer success, then know that you cauterize it according to this manner: command the patient to rest their head on their side, and hold their head with a minister between their thighs in such a way that it is neither moved nor agitated by their own head.
E aprop pausa coto enfus en album de huou o en mucellage de ptilli sobre le huel de lu.	And then place a small amount of hot wax or a paste of goose grease on the tear duct of the eye.
E aprop igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma:	And then heat the cautery whose form is as follows:
le qual sia conquau, ayssi cum es forma de cana o de pena de voltor, de la una extremitat am la qual es fayta lo cauteri.	which is curved, in the shape of a cane or a quill, from one end where the cautery is made.
E si voys, sia penetrant entro a la autra extremitat.	And if you look, they penetrate into the other extremity.
E si vols sia sort ayssi cum tenta.	And if you want to get out this way with an attempt.
Mays empero aquel que es concau es milhor a la tieua obra.	However, he who is experienced is better at the work of healing.
E aprop prem la fistula si es uberta, e tra de lu sania et exsicca aquela.	And press the fistula if it is open, and draw out the pus and dry it up.
E si no es uberta, lahoras obre aquela e extratz la poyredura de lu.	And if it is not open, then open it and extract the abscess from them.
E aprop pausa sobre lu le cauteri le qual sia be ignit, e te am aquel la tieua ma un petit deves le cauteri del huel a la partida del nas, per so que no erre la tua ma o le malaute sia enquietat, e lahoras pausa le cauteri en le grays del huel e corrompas aquel.	Then place over it the hot cautery, and with your hand, gently press against the part of the nose, so that your hand or the patient's pain is not aggravated, and apply the cautery to the edges of the ulcer and burn it away.
E donc si al comensament del tieu cauteri perve entro al os, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera le cauteri una veguada o dos, si mestiers era; e layssa aquel ayssi per tres jorns, e aprop pausa sobre aquel coto am boder e enviro lu am enguent exsiccatiu entro que sia sanat.	And therefore, if at the beginning of applying the cautery it penetrates into the bone, that is good; otherwise, repeat the cautery once or twice, if necessary, and leave it in place for three days, then apply pressure over that area with a border and surround it with an antiseptic ointment until it heals.
Mays si eran passatz xi dias e no es sanat, lahoras pausa sobre lu medicina aguda corrosiva entro que l’os sia descubert e sia ras segon que conveneys en le sieu capitol.	If after passing ten days it does not heal, then apply a strong corrosive medicine over it until the bone is exposed and cut according to what is convenient in its chapter.
E es autra manieyra de cauteri de fistula la qual alscus primiers diysero: enten al loc de la fistula e fen aquela e aprop pausa en aquela fissura camaen subtil del qual es la forma de lu: E fon en aquela la quantitat de i unc de plom fundut; e te la tua ma am camaem am bona retencio, e no sia maugut le malaute per so que le plom fundut no pervengua al huel de aquel; e cove que pausas sobre le huel del malaute coto enfus en album de huou o en aygua, quar plom adhureys le loc de la fistula e sana aquela per sanacio meravilhora.	There is another way to treat a fistula, which some masters mentioned first: enter the place of the fistula and clean it, then apply pressure on that small fissure whose form is thus: and pour into it as much melted lead as necessary; hold your hand with good tension, avoiding any harm to the patient so that the melted lead does not reach the wound; and cover the part where you are applying pressure over the patient's wound with a cloth soaked in honey or water, so that the lead hardens on the fistula and heals it by extraordinary means.
E si la fistula es sanada am aquo que havem dit del cauteri e de la curacio, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari aministrar trauc del nas e reduzir la fistula al cors del nas segon que vindra en son loc propri.	And if the fistula is healed with what we have said about cauterization and treatment, it is good; otherwise, it will be necessary to administer a drain from the nose and return the fistula to its place in the nose as it should be.
Capitol .xviii.	**Chapter XVIII**
De cauterizacio de la fendedura des potz.	**On the Cauterization of Hernia**
Motas veguadas accideysso fissuras en las labias, e majorment en las labias dels enfantz.	Frequent accidents cause fissures in the lips, especially in children's lips.
Donc cum tu curas aquelas fissuras am aquo que nos havem dit en las divisios e no aprofieyta la tua cura, lahoras igneys le cauteri petit cutellar segon aquesta forma que s’ensiec:	Therefore, if you treat those fissures as we have said in the previous sections and do not profit from your treatment, then use a hot iron in the shape of a knife as follows:
E sia la conquavitat de lu segon la subtilitat de cotella.	and the cavity of it according to the thinness of the knife.
Aprop pausa aquel init cuytadament en aquelas fissuras entro que·l cauteri pervengua al preon de las fissuras.	Place your hand carefully over those cracks so that the cautery reaches the depth of the cracks.
E aprop cura aquel am cerotz entro que sia sanat.	And then take care of that dressings while it is still fresh.
Capitol .xix.	**Capitol XIX**
De cauterizacio de fistula en la boca.	**On the Cauterization of Fistulas in the Mouth**
Quan en la razit de uvula o en le paladar o en las razitz de las dentz endeve apostema e aprop fa brac, e aprop es rompuda, e aprop es antiquada, e corr brac e es fayta fistula, e aprop tu curas aquela e no aprofieyta a curacio, lahoras cove que tu igniscas cauteri segon la quantitat que sia receubuda en la fistula, e aprop met aquel ignit en le trauc de la fistola, e te la tua ma entro que pervengua le ferr ignit al preon de lu, e al derier de lu fazen aysso una veguada o dos; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que nos havem dit de la curacio entro que sia sanat.	When, during the extraction of the uvula, the palate, or the teeth roots, bleeding occurs and it does not stop, and a fistula forms, and you do not treat it properly, then you should ignite a cautery according to the size of the fistula, and insert that flame into the opening of the fistula, and with your hand, gently guide the burning tip until it reaches the depth, and repeat this once or twice; and take care of the dressing as we have said for the healing process.
E donc si la sania es abscindita e es sanat, bo es; e sino, lahoras es necessari de descubrir le loc e hostar le os corrumput segon que vindra en son capitol.	And so if the wound is incised and cleaned, it is good; otherwise, it becomes necessary to expose the location and remove the corrupted bone as described in its chapter.
Capitol .xx.	**Capitol XX.**
De cauterisacio de las dentz e de mollificacio de las angivas.	On the cauterization of teeth and the softening of vessels.
Quan las angivas son mollificadas per humiditat e las dentz son maugudas, e curas aquelas am medicinas e no confereys, lahoras pausa le cap del malaute en le tieu se, e aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra aprop aysso, enayssi que tu pauses la quanula sobre la dent e entromet en aquela le cauteri ignit festinantment, e te la tieua ma un petit entro que·l malaute cente la calor del foc a la razit de la dent esser pervenguda.	When the vessels are softened by moisture and the teeth are loosened, and treatment with medicines does not help, then place the patient's head on the affected area, and shape the cautery so that it approaches the tooth, but do not press too hard so that the patient feels the heat of the fire at the root of the tooth being treated.
E aprop leva la tua ma, e aprop itera le cauteri alcunas veguadas segon que vols.	Then remove your hand, and repeat the cautery several times as desired.
E aprop le malaute huompla la sua boca de aygua de sal e tengua aquela per una hora, e pueys stupa aquela, quar la dent mauguda es fermada e la gengiva mollificada es strenguda e la humiditat corrompuda es exsiccada.	Then make the patient gargle with salt water and do this for an hour, then stop it, because the loosened tooth will be firmly set, the softened gums will tighten, and the moistened humors will dry out.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter .xxi.
De cauterisacio de dolor de dent.	About the treatment of tooth pain.
Quan dolor de dent es per fregiditat, o en lu es freg o verm, o no comfereys la curacio am medicina, lahoras cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am boder de vacas, o cauteri am foc.	When tooth pain is due to coldness or there is swelling or pus, and the treatment with medicine does not help, then cauterization is performed in two ways: either with a cow's hoof cautery or with a fire cautery.
Cauteri am boder es que tu prenguas boder de vacas e bulhas aquel en culhe de ferr , e aprop pren coto e envolopa le sobre la extremitat de la tenta, e aprop enmergeys aquel am boder bulhit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolorosa festinantment entro que sia enfregidat.	Cautery with a cow's hoof involves taking the hoof of a cow and piercing it in the fire until it becomes hot, then handling it carefully, wrapping it over the affected tooth, and pressing it against the aching tooth until it cools down.
E aprop itera aquela alcunas veguadas entro que la vertut del foc pervengua a la razit de la dentz.	And repeat this several times until the heat from the fire reaches the root of the tooth.
E si voys, submergeys lana o coto en le boder desus dit, e pausa aquel sobre la dent dolent, e pausa sobre aquel ferr ignit entro que·l ferr pervengua al preon de la conquavitat de la dent.	And if you see, dip some cloth or cotton in the wound on top of the tooth, place that over the painful spot, and place the heated iron on it until the iron reaches the depth of the tooth's cavity.
Mays empero la cauterizacio am foc es que tu atendas a la quannula de eram o de ferr, e sia en le cor de lu alcuna grocesa e la acuitat del foc no pervengua a la boca del malaute.	However, the use of fire for cauterization only applies to external wounds or cuts, and it should not be too severe nor should the heat of the fire reach the hernia's opening.
E aprop igneys le cauteri la forma del qual vindra, e pausa aquel sobre la dent e te la tua ma entro que·l cauteri sia enfregidat; e fay aquo alcunas veguadas quar la dolor sira remauguda o en aquel dia o en l’autre dia.	Then shape the cautery to fit, place it over the tooth and hold your hand over it until the cautery cools down; do this several times as the pain may return either on that day or the next.
E cove que per empressio de aquel cauteri que·l malaute umpla la sieua boca de bon boder e tengua aquel per una hora e aprop scupa le; e aquesta es la forma del cauteri.	And ensure that, with urgency in preparing the cautery, the patient opens their mouth well and holds it for an hour, then spit it out; this is the shape of the cautery.
E cauteriza am qual que tu voys extremittat segon que a tu es possible.	And apply a cautery where you have made an incision as best as you can.
E aquesta es la forma de la cannula:	And this is the shape of the cannula:
Capitol .xxii.	Chapter XXII.
De cauterizacio de extrophulos.	On cauterization of extrophy.
Quan extrophulos so de flecma e de humors fregas e no so hobedientz a digistio per medicinas e tu voys la digistio de aquelas leugerament, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri conquau la forma del qual es aquesta seguen, havent dos extremitatz hubertas per que yesca le fum deves le cauteri per l’autra extremitat, e pausa aquel ignit sobre aquel apostema una veguada, e autre si indigeyses de aquel, entro que pervengua al preon del apostema.	When extrophy is caused by fluid and humors that do not obey digestion due to medicines, and you need to force them slightly, then apply the cautery flame according to this form, having two sharp ends so that the smoke goes up from one end, and pause the ignited flame on the affected area once, and repeat if needed until it reaches the depth of the apostema.
E si l’apostema es pauca, lahoras pausa le cauteri segon la quantitat del apostema, e aprop leyssa le per tres jorns e pausa sobre lu coto enfus en boder entro que sia remaugut aquo que·l foc ha comburit.	And if the apostema is small, then pause the cautery according to the size of the apostema, and wrap it tightly for three days, pausing to apply a cool compress to the affected area until any remaining burn has healed.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent e tentas e draps entro que sia sanat.	And then apply that ointment and bandages until it is healed.
E la forma de la cannula o deu cauteri a tal es comveyter.	And the shape of the cannula or pointed cautery is used in this manner.
Capitol .xxiii.	**Chapter XXIII**
De cauterizacio de rauquiera de votz e de constriccio de ale.	On the cauterization of raw wounds and the constriction of arteries.
Quan las humiditatz veno sobre le quanal del pulmo, e majorment quan aquo es am fregiditat de compleccio, lahoras cove que·l malaute sia evacuat al comensament am medicinas laxativas, e aprop cauteriza aquel deves la razit del golayro en le loc depremegut.	When humidity appears on the lung's surface and particularly when it is chilled by contact, one must understand that this illness needs to be evacuated at the beginning with laxative medicines, and then cauterize that place with a pointed instrument in the affected area.
E guarda te que no pervenguas am le cauteri al golayro ni no comburas de la codena de lu sino un pauc.	And be careful not to penetrate the gullet with the cautery nor inflame the patient's bowels, but only slightly.
E cauteriza aquel am autra cauteri deves la junctura del col en le derier espondil de lu.	And cauterize that area or another cautery as needed on the joint of the neck in the last spine of the patient.
E·l cauteri de lu sia clavilh sego la maniera precedent.	The cautery of him is fastened in the manner previously described.
E aprop cura aquel am aquo que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	Then apply care to that as previously described until it is healed.
Capitol .xxiiii.	Chapter XXIII
De cauterizacio de malautia del pulmo e de tos.	On cauterization for lung diseases and cough.
Quan tos e malautia de pulmo so de humiditatz fregas e le malaute no ha febre ni tisic e es malautia antiqua, lahoras cauterisa aquel am dos cauteris sobre la furcula en les locz depremegutz leontz e buoytz; e am autra cauteri en le mieg loc del pietz entre dos mamillos; e sia le cauteri clavilh segon la forma precedent.	When cough and lung diseases are caused by excessive humidity, and the patient has no fever or sputum, and it is an old condition, then cauterize with two cauteries on the furcula in the areas where the lungs are congested and painful; and another cautery at the mid-point of the foot between the big toe and the second toe; and fasten the cautery as previously described.
E si vols, sia la tua cauterizacio punctan am le cauteri que es apelat puncta, la forma del qual precedeys en la ponctacio de dolor de aurelhas.	And if you wish, your puncturing cautery can be the one called a point, the shape of which precedes in the puncturing of earache pain.
E sian puntz entro cays ad aquels; e aprop cura aquel am aquo meteys que es precedit entro que sia sanat.	And make punctures within these; and then carefully treat that with the medicines that are mentioned, before it is healed.
E ya sia le cauteri haventz tres ramps quar cauterizacio es am aquel: am una veguada podes far tres cauteris segon aquesta forma:	And now the cautery has three points for cauterization, and it is done in this way: once you can make three cauteries according to this form.
Capitol .xxv.	Chapter XXV.
De cauterizacio de titillic que es le cap del ajutori.	On cauterization of the titillary (veins) which is the head of the assistant.
Quan le cap del ajutori es dislocat per causa de humiditatz lubricas e no es fermat en la hora del sieu retornament deves la sua dislocacio entro que sia a lu aquo costuma de retornar, e aprop per un petit movement es deslocat ayssi que s’endeve, ayssi cum nos havem testificat, lahoras cove que primieyrament redusiscas la dislocacio, e aprop le malaute sia reversat sobre le sieu dos o sobre le latz sa; e aprop eleva la codena la qual es en la partida dedintz del citillic a las partidas desus am les ditz de la tua ma sinistra, si la junctura es dislocada a las partidas dedintz.	When the head of the assistant is dislocated due to slippery humidity and it does not stop at the time of its return, you must reduce its dislocation until it is in its usual place, and then gently move it back as we have witnessed; first reduce the dislocation, and then have the patient lie on their back or side; and raise the knee that was affected by the dislocation, placing it above the hip joint using your left hand.
E aprop igneys le cauteri havent dos caps; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And then apply the cautery, which has two ends; and this is its shape:
E aprop cauteriza la codena entro que penetre aquela entro al autre latz; e vindra la figura de cauterizacio lahoras de iv caps cauteris.	Then cauterize the opening through which that one penetrates into the other side; and the figure of the cauterization will be seen when two cautery ends are used.
e so aquel subtils segon la quantitat de tenta; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	and so it is subtle according to the quantity of trial; and this is its form:
E alcunas veguadas es ajustat segon aquest comte i per que son les cauteris .viii.	And sometimes it is adjusted according to this rule, and that is the reason for the cauterizations. VIII.
E aprop pausa sobre le cauteri porys cuytz am sal, e aprop fay adherir le malaute a trenquilitat, e lo membre no sia maugut per alcun temps entro que sia confortat. De cauterizacio del stomac.	On cauterization of the stomach.

De perforacio de apostema del fietge am cauteri.	On the incision of an abscess in the leg with cautery.

De cauterizacio de plauresi.	On the cauterization of pleurisy.
Diyssero les antics cauteri de las razitz de aristologia a plauresi frega segon aquesta manieyra esser fazedor, e es aquest que tu prenguas de las razitz de aristologia longa secca una razit pun longua que es trobada, e sia de la grossetut del dit.	The ancient methods of cauterization for pleurisy, according to this practice, involve taking the long, thin blade of an old-style scalpel and making a single cut with it, of appropriate thickness.

De la cauterizacio de la melsa.	# Cauterization of the Melsa
Quan tu curas la malautia de la melsa am aquo que havem dit de la curacio en la divisio e no confereys la tua curacio, lahoras cauteri en lu es segon tres manieras, las quals totas son dreyturieras, de las quals la una es que fassas tres cauteris o quatre linhan segon la longitut de la melsa segon la figura dels cauteris del fietge, la figura dels quals ha precedit.	When treating the illness of the gums with the method we have described for treatment in the division and you do not apply your care, use cautery on it in three ways, all of which are correct, one being that you make three or four incisions according to the length of the gum as per the shape of the cautery marks on the tissue.
E sia entre quascun cauteri la grossetut d’un dit o un pauc mes, e la manieyra del cauteri sia la manieyra la qual havem dita en le cauteri del fietge engualment.	And between each cautery, the thickness of a finger or slightly less, and the manner of the cautery is the manner we have described for the cautery marks on the tissue overall.
E no compremas la tua ma am le cauteri; e le malaute sia eves sobre lo sieu dos.	And do not hold your hand against the cautery; and the illness should be on its side.

And there is another way to cauterize, which is that you light the cautery with two directions, which we have described in the chapter on the dislocation of muscles, and raise the cord that is on the straight part of the gum where it rests on the patient's left side.
E sia la tua elevacio am la qual elevas la codena segon la longuesa del cors, per que sian faytz cauteris segon la latitut del cos.	And let your elevation be such that you raise the body according to its length, so that cauterization is done according to the part of the body.

E aprop extrayt le cauteri; e donc son faytz quatre cauteris.	Then remove the cauterization; and thus four cauterizations are made.
