Capitol .xl.	Chapter .XL.
De cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua.	On cauterization of the dislocated ankle.
Quan humiditatz moucozas so efundudas a la partida de la anqua, e so faytas causas del yssiment del sieu loc, e senhal de lu es que la coyssa es prolonguada sobre l’autre quan so comparadas entre lor.	When moist mucous membranes are infiltrated at the joint of the ankle, and this causes displacement of its parts, a sign of it is that the affected side remains prolonged over the other when compared between them.
E le loc de la dislocacio es atrobat en lu quays boyt.	And the place of the dislocation is obstructed with some hard object.
Adonc cove que cauterizas le malaute sobre la partida de la anqua de lu am cauteri a sercle semblant, pus que tu auras senhat am tenta en le cercuit de la partida ayssi cum es revolguda, e per so que la partida caia el mieg loc del cercle.	Then you should cauterize the patient over the dislocated ankle with a circular cautery, because you have already tried to reduce it by moving the joint in a circle, and thus the dislocation falls into its proper place within the ring.
E sia le cauteri del qual precedit la forma en la cauterizacio del estomac.	And the cautery mentioned above has the same form as the cauterization of the stomach.
E si aquest cauteri no es a tu present, lahoras cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris am cauteri olivar gran.	And if this cautery is not at hand, then cauterize it with three large olive cauteries.
E sia fayt le cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de tota la codena; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And make the cautery according to the amount of inflammation in all the wound; and take care that what is healed be properly cared for.
Capitol .xli.	Chapter .XLI.
De cauterizacio de la vena sciatica.	On the cauterization of the sciatic vein.
Quan dolor ve en la partida de anqua, e so causa de lu freg et humiditatz, le malaute es curat am aquo que havem dit e no confereys, e aquo es antiquat, lahoras cove que tu lacses le malaute de humors grosses am pillulas fetidas o am pillulas artificials o semblantz; e aprop cauteriza aquel.	When pain appears in the lower part of the body, caused by cold, wetness, and inflammation, the patient is treated with the methods we have mentioned, and these are ancient practices. Then you should remove the thick humors from the body using foul pills or artificial ones or similar; and then cauterize it.
E la manieyra del cauteri en aquela es segon dos manieyras: o cauteri am medicinas comburentz, o cauteri am foc.	And the method of the cautery on that part follows two ways: either with cauterizing medications that burn, or with fire.
Sira segon dos manieyras scientas, de las quals es la una que cauterizes aquel sobre la partida de l’ancha de lu am tres cauteris triangulatz segon aquesta forma; e fay am aquels bona profunditat.	It follows two knowledgeable methods, of which one is to cauterize that over the opening of the hernia with three triangular cauterizes according to this form; and make them as deeply as possible.
E sia le spazi le qual es entre cascun cauteri la quantitat de la grossitut del dit e si le cauteri olivar o gran.	And the space between each cauterize should be according to the thickness of the said part, and if the cautery is olive-sized or large.
Mays alcunas veguadas sia le cauteri sobre le mieg loc sobre le cap de l’anquan per que son quatre cauteris.	In some cases, the cauterizes may be placed over the mid-section on the hernia's head, making it four in total.
E si vols, cauteriza am le cercle del qual es precesida la forma en la cauterizacio de la dislocacio de l’anqua, la i que sia cercle continent e comburey la ispicitut de tota la codena.	And if you wish, cauterize the circle from which the shape precedes in the cauterization of the hernia's displacement, one that is a containing circle and burns away the stiffness of all the ligaments.
E aquesta es la manieyra de cauteri in ciatiqua quan dolor es adherent al anqua e no es estenduda entro a la coyssa.	And this is the method of cauterization in this case when the pain is localized to the hernia and does not extend into the thigh.
Mays si es estenduda entro a la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel am dos cauteris sobre la coyssa sobre le loc al qual envireys le malaute que es la dolor; e am un cauteri sobre la cavilha per quatre ditz un pauc deves la part cilvestra.	If it is extended inside the thigh, then cauterize that place with two cautery irons over the affected area where the pain is located; and place a cautery on the ankle for four days, slightly to the outer side.
E si le cauteri cutellar, e sia la profunditat del cauteri segon la quantitat de la ispicitut de la codena.	And if the cautery is cutaneous, then the depth of the cautery should be according to the amount of inflammation in the condition.
E si le malaute envireys que la dolor es estenduda entro al loc prop les ditz des pes, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui on envireys am cauteri per tres puntz o quatre o mays si indigeys de aquel.	And if the condition causes pain to spread to the nearby areas of the feet, then cauterize that place with an iron having three, four, or more points, as needed.
E si le malaute envireys dolor esser dejos le donolh ves la coyssa, lahoras cauteriza aquel aqui am un cauteri cutellar.	And if the condition causes pain to remain in the thigh after movement, then cauterize that place with a cutaneous cautery iron.
E guarda te en tota cauterizacio que no ultimes am le cauteri en tant que comburas nervi o gran arceria, e que per aquo a tu es sobre le malaute mal noccument o contraccio.	And be careful in all cauterization so that you do not sever nerves or cause great damage, and through this, the condition is relieved without harm or constriction.
E yeu ja e vist un e autre de aquels les quals cauterizero sobre la cavilha e ultimero en la cauterizacio, e la cama foc inflada entro que la tumor aconseguit lo pe, e foc perforat e corromput tot le pe.	And you have already seen one of those which will be cauterized over the bone and finished in the cauterization process, and the bed of fire inflated until the tumor reaches the foot, and fire pierced and corrupted all the foot.
E aprop accidic fort solucio de ventre, e aprop aquo la mort.	And then I apply a strong acid solution of the belly, and thus I bring about death.
E si la dolor es en dos partidas ensemps cauteriza quascuna segon aquesta manieyra.	And if the pain is in two parts, simultaneously cauterize each according to this manner.
E diysero les savis alcus en la cauterizacio de anqua cauteri del qual aquesta es la manieyra: fay semblant a cercle de ferr del qual le cercuit sia la maytat de un palm; e sia deves le sieu orrifici segon la grossesa de un os de datil o mens un pauc.	And the wise ones say about the cauterization of water cauteries, of which this is the manner: make it resemble a circle of iron whose circumference is the width of a palm; and its point should be as thick as a date palm bone or slightly more.
E dedintz aquel cercle sia un autre tertz; e sia le spazi le qual es entre lor la quantitat del notz del pous; e sian aquels cercles ubertz de dos partidas; e sia la longitut de aquels cays un notz o dos notz, e fay en aquels margue de ferr decentment apparelhat en les cercles; e aquesta es la forma de lu:	And within that circle, another third should be made; and the space between them is the width of a night's rest; and those circles are divided into two parts; and the length of those lines is one or two nights, and make on the edge of those iron circles a proper dressing in the circles; and this is the form of it.
Aprop sia ignit en le foc entro que s’enrogesisca e gete scintillas, e aprop sia pausat sobre la partida del anqua, le malaute colcat sobre le latz sa.	Near the fire, it is lit so that it may heat and give off sparks, and then it is placed over the water's edge, the patient lying on their side.
E donc cauteriza aquel am tres cauteris redontz en una veguada.	And so it is cauterized with three pointed cauteries at once.
E aprop layssa aquel per tres jorns; aprop emplastre aquel am boder e layssa la plagua uberta per trops dias; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then it is left like that for three days; the wound is dressed with a border and left open for too many days; and the treatment continues until it is healed.
Diys Albucasis : o, filhs, de aquesta specia de cauteri pauc havem usat per la terror del reguardament de lu, e per aquo que paucs havem trobatz les quals reguardan sobre lu.	Albucasis says: O, my sons, of this kind of cautery we have used little due to the fear of its appearance, and because few of us have found those that regard it favourably.
Mays dels bos cauteris a lu qui les sufferta, et atroba am aquel le loc de lu.	One may use the best cautery on him who suffers greatly, and find comfort in the place of his pain.
Mays cauteri am medicinas adhurentz es que tu fassas dos cercles haventz armula perforada en la qual deyssen le guaffo de la porta de ferr; sia la longuitut de la paretz en la nauteza de lor sian dos nozes o quays aquels.	Perhaps the text is describing a surgical procedure:
E si le spazi le qual es entre quascu la quantitat de la grossitut del dit; e sian ubertz dejos e desus, e sian que contenguan se entre lor segon aquesta forma:	And if the space between certain parts of the body is such that it corresponds to the thickness of the said part, they should be opened from above and below, and placed so as to hold each other in this manner:
E aprop pausa sobre la partida de la anqua le malaut jasent sobre le latz sa, e comprem la tua ma sobre la partida de la anqua; e aprop pren de aygua cauda e fon la entre dos cercles, e la qualiditat de aquela sia am le foc petit a petit, e te aquela per la quantitat de una hora, e sufferta le malaute la mordicacio e la adhustio de lu — quar aquel atrobo mordicacio ayssi cum de foc — entro que cesse la mordicacio.	Then place your hand over the part where the patient feels pain in their side, and take some cold water, forming it into two circles, and applying it gradually to that area for an hour; and as the patient endures the biting and tightening (as if from fire) of the pain, until the biting ceases.
E aprop eleva la tua ma am le instrument et abstergeys l’aygua cauda de tota la anqua am aygua dousa.	Then raise your hand holding the instrument, and remove the cold water from all parts of the affected area with warm water.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres jorns e pausa sobre aquel boder entro que sia la negror de la adhustio remauguda, e leyssa aquo per alcus jorns, e correra de lu poyredura; aquest es derier en juvament.	Then apply this for three days, and place your hand over the affected area until the swelling returns to its original state, and repeat this for some more days, and it will prevent future occurrences; this is the best course of action for young people.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz entro que sia sanat.	And then attend to that wound until it heals.
E si la dolor es extenduda entro la coyssa o la camba, fay a lu estatua en lu que contengua aygua segon que es feyt en la anqua engualment.	If the pain is widespread in the thigh or leg, make him lie down with his affected part raised as if he were lying in water according to what is done in equal amounts of water.
E aquesta es la manieyra de aygua cauda, e yeu ja he scrit aquela en le tractat de la rectificacio de medicinas.	And this is the manner of water treatment, and you have already written about it in the treatise on the rectification of medicines.
Recipe de alcali e de caus no extinta de amdos ana partida una, e trissa les e pausa en una ola nova de la qual la partida dejos sia perforada per un petit trauc, segon la quantitat que intre en lu ray.	Prepare a mixture of alkali and the cause of both parts, then press them and place them in a new wave from which the opening is perforated with a small tool according to the quantity that goes into it.
E pausa dejos le fons de la ola autra ola enveyriada, e gete sobre aquel alcali e caus viva de aygua doussa la qual cobra aquels per un dit, e pus que tu compremes aquels am la tieua ma per bona compressio, e leyssa la hola que deyssenda de lu aygua aguda en la partida dejos a la ola enveyriada.	And then place the bottom of the wave over another wave in which you have immersed the alkali and causes of warm water for two fingers, and afterward, compress them with your hand over the tieua (presumably a type of material or tool) tightly, and allow the hot water from the alkali to descend into the opening left by the cold water.
E aprop ajusta tota aquela aygua, e geta la sobre autra caus viva e autre alcali renovelatz, quar aquela lahoras sira de mot forta acuitat, la qual es aministrada en motas operacios de medicina e en cauterizacio dels autres membres, quar operacio fa de foc.	And then carefully adjust all that water, and mix it with another living cause and other renewable alkalis, so that it becomes a strong, sharp liquid, which is administered in most medical operations and the cauterization of other members, for operation uses fire.
E so de las medicinas alcunas am las quals es cauterizat ancha, ayssi cum tezizic e mel anacrat e caus am sabo enayssi que sian mesclatz.	And among these medicines are some that use cauterization, with quick and powerful herbs and substances that cause a burning sensation, so they are mixed together.
E Gualia recontet de un home dels antics la operacio e la curacio am la qual es curada dolor de anqua e de vena sciatica, e magnifiquet mot be esser de aquel, e diys que no hac necessitat de autra curacio, e quar es sanat per una veguada ayssi cum recomtec, quar fort leu aquel intrec en banh e eysic ja sa d’aquel.	An ancient man describes an operation and cure for pain in the knees and sciatica, and marvels greatly at its effectiveness, saying that no other treatment is needed, as it heals completely with a single application, when one immerses oneself in hot water and rests immediately from that moment.
Et es que sia pres de certarragi vert, e si no es atrobat vert, sia presa figua recent; e mot sia trissada am un pauc de grays e sia pausat sus la anqua en la qual es la dolor, o en la coyssa, o en la camba, e sia liat.	It is that one should use fresh parsley from a certain plant, and if it is not available, take a recent fig; twist it slightly with some salt and place it in the water where the pain is, or on the affected area, or on the leg, and let it be.
E sia layssat per la cantitat de tres horas o per la quantitat que·l malaute centa cedacio de la adhustio.	And it should be left for a period of three hours or for as long as the pain requires adjustment.
E aprop met aquel en banh e donc quan le cors de lu sia enrozat, entromet aquel en le sol, quar la dolor cessa e es sanat.	Then immerse him in water and when the patient's body is relaxed, insert the hot (object) into the sole, as the pain ceases and healing occurs.
E sapias que no cove que alcu use de cauteri am aquestas medicinas sino aprop la evacuacio del cors.	And be aware that no one should use cautery with these treatments unless it is for the evacuation of the body.
Mays ja Escorides diysec que quan am fenda de cabra la vena stretica es cauterizada, aprofieyra a lu mo be; e sia le cauteri am lu segon aquesta manieyra: sia presa lana e sia enbeguda en oli antic, e sia pausat entre le pous del pe e entre le fossil.	You may already know that when the narrow vein of a goat is cauterized, it helps the animal; and the cautery should be applied to them in this manner: take wool and dip it in old oil, and place it between the foot's toes and between the bones.
E aprop pren fenda de cabra secca e emflasma aquela am foc entro que sia fayta carbo; e aprop pausa lu sobre la lana e leysa la entro que sia estengida.	And take a dry goat's vein and apply it to the fire until it becomes charred; then place it on the wool and leave it inside until it is stretched.
E aprop itera aquo, e no cessas far aquo entro que·l scintiment de la mordicacio pervengua entro al anqua e repausa la dolor.	And then repeat this process, and do not cease to do so until the sensation of the bite disappears in the water and relieves the pain.
Et aquesta manieyra de cauteri es apelat cauteri de vaquas.	And this method of cautery is called the "cattle cautery.

Alcunas veguadas dolor es en le dos per tropas causas, cum per cazement o per percucio o per superflua evacuacio, e per causas ad aquelas semblantz, per infusio de materia frega e humida. De cauterizacio al comensament de gilbositat.	On cauterization at the onset of jaundice.

This malady often manifests in young children; and the sign of its onset in children is that their small bodies become stiff in the evening, hindering their elevation and movement.

De cauterizacio de podagra e de dolor de juncturas.	On the cauterization of gout and joint pain.
Quan dolor de juncturas son faytas per humors fregas les quals so enfundutz a quascun membre del cors, lahoras quan veno dolors en los pes, de costuma dels metges es que aquo apelen podragua propriament.	When joint pain is caused by cold humors that infiltrate each part of the body, and pain occurs in the feet, it is customarily called gout by doctors.

De cauterizacio de rompeduras.	On cauterization of breaks.
Quan endeve rompedura en les angonars e diysendo les budels denant l’atela al genetiu, e aquo es comensan de aprop, lahoras cove que tu mandas al malaute layssar la sua comestio en le sieu dia e que use de causas leniens per so que la fenda deyssenda del sieu ventre.	When a rupture occurs in the angles and hernia protrudes from the abdomen, then it is necessary to begin by returning the intestine to its cavity, and you must ensure that the patient abstains from strenuous activity on that day and uses gentle remedies so that the opening in their stomach heals.

entro que sia mot rog e gete cintilhas.	Within which a hot and moist wound lies.

And then apply the cautery over that sign with your hand, using cautery tools straight, and aim between the bones of the thigh within the middle of the muscle; repeat that another time if you have not achieved it on the first attempt between the bones.
E observa saviament del ysiment del budel en la hora de la tua cauterizacio, que no comburas aquel budel per so que sobre le malaute no vengua in mort o autre gran malicia.	And observe carefully the position of the hernia during the cauterization, that you do not burn the hernia so that it does not lead to death or other great harm on top of the illness.

E cove que·l cauteri dels enfants sia subtil segon le gran e la mesura de lor.	And take care that the cautery on children should be subtle according to their size and measurement.

E cove que pauses le nutriment de lu segon la longitut del temps de la curacio de lu le qual le linesca le ventre de lu, e que le budel no yesca fora deves le esforsament de guerir.	And take care to give them no food according to the duration of their healing, as it weakens their stomach, and ensure that the hernia does not protrude due to efforts to heal.
E aprop quan se vol levar aprop xl dias, lahoras aministra liament decentment fayt, e tengua aquel per autres xl jorns.	And then, when it is desired to raise it after approximately ten days, administer a suitable remedy and maintain that for another forty days.
E sia mermat de trebalh e de replecio de vianda e de beure, e de votz vehementz, quar quan usa de aquest regiment de sanacio entiera sira sanat.	And also reduce work and the intake of food and drink, and avoid loud voices, for when one follows this regimen of healing entirely, they will be restored to health.
E yeu diyre la curacio de las rupturas en las autras partidas del ventre, e so al comensament, e vols que no treguan, lahoras cauterisa la ruptura d’aquel am cauteri redon segon la quantitat de lu, e sia aquo que es exhurit de la codena ayssi cum la tersa partida de lu; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit, e no es ajustat.	And now I will describe the treatment for ruptures in other parts of the abdomen, at the very beginning, and so that they do not reopen, cauterize the rupture with a red hot iron according to its size, and it is this same fluid that is expelled from the intestines; then care for that as we have said, and do not allow it to recur.
E ja diyssero alcus primiers que ruptura sia cauterizada am cauteri triangular segon aquesta forma, pus que es senhada am tenta:	And some have previously said that the first rupture should be cauterized with a triangular iron according to this form, as it is recognized by trial.
e es pausada linha que eys per la latitut en le latz pus sobira de la ruptura, e autra linha al desus; e depausa la tua ma am un cauteri clavilh, mays le primier cauteri es pus leugier e milhor.	And it is a pause line that they hold in the width on both sides of the rupture, and another line above it; then place your hand with a pointed cautery, but the first cautery is lighter and better.
Capitol .xlvi.	**Capitol .XLVI.** (The number XLVI represents the Roman numeral for 46)
De cauterizacio de torcio.	**On the Cauterization of Twists**
Quan endeve en alscus membres per cazement o per percussio dolor e persevera aquela dolor per lonc temps e no comfereys al u curacio am medicinas, lahoras cove que cauterizes am cauteri de punt.	When pain persists in various members due to injury or impact and continues for a long time without responding to medical treatments, then apply cauterization with a pointed cautery.
E sia le cauteri de tot membre segon la magnitut e la parvitat de lu, e vertut e develitat de lu, e locacio de torcio e dolor de lu.	And the type of cautery should be for each member according to its size and depth, and the nature and location of the twist and pain in it.
Donc si·s sanat per le primier cauteri, bo es; e sino, lahoras itera sobre lu le cauteri; quar de costuma de aquelas dolors es que sian punctatz de membre ad aquel membre le qual apropinque al u, per que cove que consieguas aquels am cauteri entro que·l malaute sia sanat.	Therefore, if it is healed by the first cautery, well; otherwise, repeat the cautery on it; for it is common with those pains that they are punctured from one member to another close to it, so be sure to obtain these pointed cauteries until the illness is cured.
Capitol .xlvii.	Chapter XLVII.
De cauterizacio de lepra.	On the cauterization of leprosy.
Les lebros alcunas veguadas am cauteri per mot gran juvament, e magerment si la specia de lepra que es fayta per putrefaccio de flacma e de melencolia.	Leprosy patients sometimes require cautery for severe damage, albeit rarely if the type of leprosy is caused by putrefaction of flesh and melancholy.
E donc cum tu vols cauterizar aquel, considera si la lepra es comussan e as aquela curada am aquo que havem dit en la divisio e no deysen, ni esta, e temes sobre le malaute que la corrupcio comprehenda tot le cors de lu e tota la compleccio de lu, lahoras cauteriza aquel sobre le cap am v cauteris: am un en le mieg loc del cap, e am le segon pus dejos de lu, eves le front a la fi dels cabels; e amdos sobre dos corns; e am un detras, sobre la nuca o servitz.	And therefore, if you wish to cauterize it, consider whether the leprosy is severe and has not been cured by what we have said in the division, and do not delay, nor hesitate, and be wary of the illness that corruption may encompass all of him and all of his integrity; then cauterize it on the head with a cautery: at the middle point of the head, and at the second place beneath it, spread the front to the end of the hair; and both on two horns; and one behind, over the nape or serve it.
E ultima la tua ma am le cauteri un pauc entro que emprema en le os una petita empressio, e de lu sian deslocadas las scorsas, per so que la expiracio de grossas vapors sia alleujada de lu; e cauteriza sobre la melsa segon que es precesit.	And lastly, apply the heat of the cautery slightly within, pressing upon the bone a slight pressure, to dislodge the clots, so that the expulsion of thick vapours is relieved; and cauterize over the wound as required.
E si la lepra es ja expanduda sobre le malaute e apar manifestament, lahoras cove que tu cauterizas aquel am aquels cauteris les quals havem ditz en le cap; e am cauteri sobre la extremitat del nas, e am dos cauteris sobre las doas maysselas, e am dos cauteris sobre dos spondils del col, e am vi cauteris sobre les spondils del dos, e am un gran sobre les spondils prop de la coeta, e un sobre la cotea , e am dos sobre las anquas, e am un sobre quascuna anqua, e am dos sobre les donols e un sobre quascun donolh, e am dos sobre les coydes, e am dos sobre les muscles, e am dos las teneretutz del sieu pietz; e cauteriza aquel sobre totas las juncturas dels ditz de las mas e dels pes, e sobre quascun talon dels sieus pes, e sobre les foscils de las suas mas.	If the leprosy has already spread over the body and appears manifestly, then you should cauterize with those cautery tools we have mentioned at the beginning; cauterize on the tip of the nose, and two cauteries on each eyelid, and two cauteries on both sides of the spine at the nape of the neck, and six cauteries on the spinal columns, and one great cautery near the coccyx, and one on the hip bone, and two on each thigh, and one on each leg, and two on each arm, and two on each muscle, and cauterize the tender parts of their feet; and cauterize all the joints of their hands and feet, and on every toe of their feet, and on the sole of their feet, and on the heel.
E guarda te dels nervis les quals so sobre le talo que no comburas aquels.	And be careful of the nerves which are on the foot, do not irritate them.
E alcunas veguadas es cauterizat am un cauteri sobre le os del pentenilh e am autre sobre la boca del stomac, e autre sobre le fietge.	And in some cases, it is cauterized with a hot iron over the bone of the thigh, and others over the opening of the stomach, and others on the colon.
E sapias que quant mays ajustas cauteris, tant es mays juvatiu e mays conferent; e sapias que le malaute no ha en le cauteri dolor, ayssi cum han les sas, per so quar le cors de lu ja es stupefayt.	And you know that the more precise the cauterization, the greater its effectiveness and the less painful it is for the patient; thus, since the body is already numbed, the pain from the cautery is minimal.
E cove que les cauteris sian grans o paucs segon les membres e las juncturas segon que es precedit de las specias dels ferramentz.	And take care that the cauteries be of appropriate size, great or small, according to the members and joints as previously described with respect to the tools.
E aprop cura le cauteri am farina de errs coyta am mel e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	And then, take care of the cauterized areas with honey mixed with flour, and other remedies internally until they are healed.
Capitol .xlviii.	Chapter .xlviii.
De cauterizacio de stupor.	On cauterization of faints.
Quan alcun membre es stabozit o adormit e es curat am medicinas, olis e emplastres, e no es sanat, lahoras tu cauteriza aquel membre stabozit am cauteris segon que merita la grandesa del membre o la parvitat de lu.	When a member is stunned or numbed and treated with medicines, oils, and bandages, but is still not healed, then you cauterize that stunned member with a hot iron according to the size of the member or the extent of its numbness.
E sia lo tieu cauteri intrant la ispicitut de la codena un pauc.	And the hot iron should enter slightly into the depth of the flesh.
E aprop cura aquel am enguent entro que sia sanat.	And then care for that, so it heals properly.
E alscunas veguadas es cauterizada alcuna stupor le qual endeve a las mas e als pes, e als spondils del dos e ves le eysiment dels nervis les quals mavon aquel membre, e es remauguda la stupor.	And sometimes faints are cauterized from the head down to the hands and feet, and along the spine and when the nerves of that member feel pain, then the faint is removed.
Mays no prusuma sobre aquo sino aquel que es savi en la anotomia dels membre e de la egressio dels nervis tot le cors moventz.	Do not press upon it unless one who is skilled in the anatomy of the members and the emergence of nerves throughout the body moves it.
Capitol .xlix.	**Chapter XLIX**
De cauterizacio de albaras que es morfea.	**On the Cauterization of Hemorrhoids**
Quan albaras es antiqua e no comfereys a lu alcu dels enguentz de medicina, lahoras tu cauteriza sobre aquela am cauteri preon un pauc segon la quantitat de la specitut de la codena entro que sia remauguda la blancor e la color de lu, e la color de lu sia mudada.	When hemorrhoids are old and do not respond to any of the usual medical treatments, then cauterize them with a cautery point, according to the quantity of the specific kind of cord within, until the white and color of it are reduced, and its color is changed.
E aprop cura aquel am farina de errs e de lentilhas am oli rozat e am folhas de arnagrosa, e am sanc de colomba o am sanc de yronda, da cascuna sia una partida e totas sian mescladas, e aprop sia linit un drap e sus le loc sia pausat entro que sia sanat.	And then prepare a mixture of flour from erg and lentils with warmed oil and leaves of arnot grass, or pigeon's blood or goose blood, each in its own portion and all mixed together, and apply it as a compress to the area until it is healed.
Capitol .l.	Chapter One.
De cauterizacio de cranc.	On the cauterization of cracks.
Quan canser es comensan e vols aquel ostar, lahoras cauteriza aquel am cauteri de cercle en le circuit de lu ayssi cum es revolgut.	When cancer begins to form and it desires to spread, cauterize it with a circular cautery along its course as it spreads.
E diysero les savis que sia cauterizat am lo derier cauteri en le mieg loc; mays a mi no es vist aquo, quar temi que sia ulcerat, e yeu ja e vist aquo alcunas veguadas.	And the learned say that it should be cauterized with the last cautery in the middle of the course; however, I have not seen this, as I fear it may be an ulcer, and I have seen this a few times before.
E es pus dreyturier que sia cauterizat en le circuit de lu am cercle ayssi cum avem dit, o am motz cauteris.	It is more advisable to cauterize it along the course of the disease with a circular cautery as we have said, or with multiple cauteries.
Capitol .li.	Chapter II.
De cauterizacio de adubilati.	On cauterization of abscesses.
Quan alcun adubilati es tardat en maturacio, e aysso es per la superfluitat fazen aquela, o per etat del malaute, quar es vielh en decrepitat, de pauc sanc, o per le temps, e tu vols festinar en la maturacio de adubilati; lahoras cauteriza en le circuit de lu am motz cauteris petitz punctan; e aprop leyssa aquela quar ela fastinara en maturacio.	When an abscess takes too long to mature, this is due to excess fluid, the state of illness, since it is old and brittle with little strength, or time, and you wish to hasten the maturation of the abscess; then cauterize around it with a number of small pointed cauteries; and apply pressure so that it will mature faster.
Mays si tu vols la perforacio de lu am cauteri, lahoras tu igneys le cauteri del qual aquesta es la forma de lu: e depausa aquel en le mieg loc de adubilati entro que penetre la codena.	If you wish to make an incision in the abscess with a cautery, then heat the cautery whose form is thus: and stop it in the middle of the abscess until the wire penetrates.
E si le cauteri en aquel loc que es pus dejos, per so que le cors del brac sia alleujat; e aprop cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And if the cautery is made at that place which is infected, in order that the body of the arm be relieved; and then take care of it until it is healed.
Capitol .lii.	Chapter .lii. (This appears to be a section header or title, indicating the start of a new topic within the treatise.)
De cauterizacio de corrodent.	On cauterization of corrosion.
Corrodent es corrupcio ambulant en le membre, la qual corrodeys aquel ayssi cum a foc comedent lenha secca.	Corrosion is a wandering corruption of the member, which corrodes it as if fire were consuming dry wood.
Donc si vezes aquel corrodent en loc le qual sufferte cauteri am foc, lahoras tu igneys cauteris clavils motz paucs, e grans segon que es convenent en aquel loc en le qual es corrodent.	If you encounter that corrosion in a place where cauterization with fire is necessary, then use hot clamps, small or large as appropriate for the location of the corrosion.
E aprop cauteriza aquel de tota partida entro que erradiques tota la corrosio e no romangua alcuna causa de lu.	And then cauterize it completely until you eliminate all corrosion and do not leave any cause for it to return.
E aprop leyssa aquel per tres dias, e pausa sobre les locs cauterizats solpre trissat am oli mesclat entro que las scaras sian totas eradicadas e tota la corrupcio.	Then bandage it for three days, and apply oil mixed with herbs continually over the cauterized areas until all scars are completely eradicated and all corruption gone.
E aprop cura aquel am enguentz carn engendrantz.	And then care for it using poultices of fresh meat.
Mays si aprop tres dias vezes que la carn nasca sana en la qual no es corrupcio, bo es; mays sino, lahoras itera le cauteri sobre aquo que es romas en les locs corrumputz.	If the flesh becomes healthy after three days without corruption, it is good; otherwise, repeat the cautery over what is broken in the corrupted places.
E corrodent es medicat alcunas vetz am medicina aguda, quar aquela es meza en loc de cauteri.	And corrosion is treated with some times acute medicine, because it is half in place of cautery.
Mays empero cauteri am foc es de pus leugier juvament.	However, cautery with fire is better to remove the leucocit (white blood cell) immediately.
E yeu ja e dit la curacio de lu am medicina aguda en la divisio, e donc pren aquela quan de lu auras endegencia.	And you have already said the treatment of it with acute medicine in the division, and therefore take that when you have any inclination towards it.
Capitol .liii.	**Chapter III**
De cauterizacio de claus e dels autres semblants.	On Cauterization of Joints and Similar Conditions
Motas veguadas endeve a las partidas dejos del pe malautia que s’apela clau, e es causa grossa, fentrada, la qual ladeys le pe; e cauteri en aquels es segon dos manieyras, so es cauteri am foc e cauteri am aygua cauda.	The visible lumps in the parts around the foot affected by illness, which is called a 'claw', are caused by a severe, penetrating condition that affects the foot; and treatments for these include cauterization with fire or with water-cooled cautery.
Mays cauteri am foc es que igniscas le cauteri concau semblant a pena de voltor, le qual sia feyt de ferr segon la quantitat la qual contengua le clau de tota partida, e sia de subtils marguas.	Cauterization with fire involves creating a burning instrument shaped like a twist of thread, made of iron according to the size of the lump, and having thin edges.
E aprop pausa aquel ignit sobre le clau, e aprop revolveys la tua ma am le cauteri en le circuit del clau entro que·l cauteri pervengua a la profunditat del clau.	Then apply the burning instrument to the lump, and carefully rotate the cautery around the lump until it reaches the depth of the lump.
E leyssa aquel per tres dias entro que comense getar brac.	And leave it for three days until it begins to heal.
E aprop emplastre aquel am malvas salvatges trissadas am sal, e leyssa le emplastre sobre aquel per una nuoyt, quar aquel sira eradicat de las suas razitz.	Then apply a paste made from dried herbs mixed with salt to the affected area, and leave it for one night so that it can eliminate the root of the problem.
E aprop cura le loc am enguent de carn generatiu entro que sia sanat.	And then treat the area with a healing ointment made from natural meat until it heals.
E si so no-convertitz, e motas veguadas accideysso en la superficia del cors, majorment en las mas e les pes, lahoras cove que tu aministres en aquels cauteri am aygua, e es que prenguas una quannula de eram o de ferr o de pena de voltor, e pausa aquela sobre le clau; e aprop geta en la quanula de aygua cauda pauca cantitat, e rete la tua ma, e tu revolveys aquela am compressio de la tua ma de tot, e sia enpremut le marge de la canula en la razit del clau, e atrobara la aygua cauda via al preon de la razit del cau; e espera le malaute un pauc la mordicacio de l’aygua cauda per una hora, e aprop remau aquela, quar le clau am las suas razitz sira erredicat.	If these measures do not help and the pain appears on the surface of the body, especially in the joints and feet, then you must administer to those cauterizations with hot water, and take a small metal needle or a sharp instrument, place it over the joint, and pour a few drops of hot water into the needle; hold your hand over it, compressing it completely, and repeatedly move the edge of the needle along the joint's base until the hot water is completely drained; wait for the patient to feel the burn from the hot water for about an hour, then remove it, as the joint's heat will have dissipated.
E ayssi fe am aquels la i aprop l’autre entro que venguas sobre totz les quals de lor so en le cors.	And also, for those who have these issues, it is important to ensure that all of them are treated.
E aprop cura aquels pus que las razitz dels claus so erradicadas am aquo dels enguentz les quals la carn ve engenran.	And also, treat the abscesses that form around the joint's roots with antiseptic ointments as the flesh regenerates.
Capitol .liiii.	Chapter III.
De cauterizacio de tremor.	On the cauterization of tremor.
Quan endeve ad alcu tremor per freg en le nervi o per febre de causa frega, o per autra causa semblant, lahoras cove que tu cauterises aquel am quatre cauteris o am v sobre les spondils del dos, entre quascun spondilh am un cauteri; e am cauteri en le pietz de lu, e sobre l‘estomac de lu, am cauteri olivar.	When you encounter any tremor caused by friction on the nerves or by fever resulting from such friction, or for other similar reasons, you should apply four small cauterizations with a hot iron to each vertebra of the back, between each vertebrae applying one cauterization; also apply cauterizations to the patient's feet, and over their stomach with olive cauterizations.
E la tremor de lu se repausa e festina la sanetat de la malautia frega.	And the tremor of the patient should cease, hastening the healing of the afflicted disease.
Capitol .lv.	Chapter V.
De cauterizacio de albati accidentz al cors.	On the cauterization of sudden accidents to the body.
Quan en le cors so espellitz albati, e so pustulas fendas las quals so feytas de materias grossas corruptas; donc cove al comensament cum apareyso, que sia cauterizat sobre tot cap de la fistola am cauteri subtil am fustz de mirt, la extremitat del qual es estenduda am foc; o am razitz de erestologia longua; o am cauteri lentecular.	When in the body white patches appear, and pustules open up that are formed from corrupt gross matter; then at the beginning with appearance, cauterize over every part of the fistula with a delicate cautery or a hot iron, whose tip is dipped in fire; or cut with a long scalpel; or cauterize with a lenticular.
E alscunas veguadas es cauteri ademamil al comensament de la sua expulcio segon aquesta manieyra; e no so cregudas, e es disrumpuda la superfluitat fazens aquels, et sana de aquels.	And in some cases, cauterization is also performed at the beginning of their expulsion according to this manner; they are not crusted, and the excess matter is removed, doing those, and healing from those.
Mays empero cove que aquo sia fayt aprop evacuacio am fleubotomia.	However, it is important to ensure that this is done with the proper evacuation through phlebotomy.
Capitol lvi.	Chapter VI.
De cauterizacio de fluex de sanc accident per incisio de arceria.	On the cauterization of flu (or venous congestion) caused by an accidental wound through an incision of the artery.
Tropas veguadas endeve fluex de arceria que es inciza deves la plagua la qual endeve deforo, o deves la incizio de apostemas o cauteri del membre, e alor semblantz, e es dificil remaura aquel.	Too many observed signs must flow from the arrowhead that pierces the wound which should be cleaned, or from the beginning of abscesses or cauterization on a limb, and then it seems similar, and it is difficult to retain this.
Donc cum accideys ad alcu aquo, lahoras tu·t coyta am la tua ma a l’orrifici de la arceria, e pausa sobre aquel le tieu dit endic estrenh aquel motas veguadas entro que sia ostat le fluex del sanc dejos le tieu dit, e que non yesqua.	So if this happens to anyone, you must hold the wound with your hand at the orifice of the arrow's impact, and place a cushion over it, keeping in mind that you should stop the flow of blood as soon as possible so that it does not gush out.
E aprop pausa en le foc les cauteris olivars paucs e grantz, per nombre motz, e exsuffla sobre aquels entro que sian mot ignitz.	And then apply olive oil cauteries, both small and large, in many places, and blow over them until they are ignited.
E aprop pren de aquels un petit o un gran segon le loc e la plagua en la qual es rompuda la arteria, sobre aquela vena festinantment pus que auras remaugut le tieu dit, e te le cauteri entro que sia abcindit e restreyt aquel sanc.	And then take from them a small or large one according to the location and the wound in which an artery is broken, pouring boiling poultice on it as you have previously cleansed the area, and cauterize it until the blood flow is stopped.
E si le sanc es expellit de l’orrifici de la arteria quan tu remaues le tieu dit e extringeys le cauteri, lahoras pren la un autre cauteri coytadament dels cauteris les quals en le foc son preparatz, e donc no cesses fer aquo un aprop autre entro que le sanc sia restrengit.	And if the blood is expelled from the orifices of the artery as you remove your hand and withdraw the cautery, take another cautery carefully from those that are prepared in the fire, and do not cease to repeat this until the bleeding stops.
E guarda te que no comburas le nervi que aqui es, e que vengua sobre le malaute autra malicia.	And be careful not to injure the nerves here, which may lead to further complications for the patient.
E sapias que quan de l’arteria flueys sanc, lahoras no es possible en aquels restrenge la sanc, e majorment quan l’arteria es gran, si no am una de quatre manieyras: o am cauteri ayssi quo dit havem, o am extraccio quan no es extrayta, quar quan es extrayta las extremitatz de lu miels son comburidas e es restreyt le sanc, o que sia liat am fiel o am liament per fort strectura, o que sian pausadas sobre lu medicinas de las quals la vertut es restringir la sanc; e sian strengudas am pulvinar am costriccio decent.	And you should know that when blood flows from the artery, it is not possible to restrict the bleeding, especially when the artery is large, unless by one of four methods: either with cautery as we have mentioned, or by extraction when it is not extracted, for when its extremities are burnt, the bleeding is restricted, or by binding it tightly with string or ligature, or by pausing over it medicines whose virtue is to restrict the bleeding; and they should be tightened at the anus or genitals with proper constriction.
Mays aquel que aministra restriccio decent de lu am liament e am strictura am draps o per posicio de causas comburentz e de semblantz, no comfereys sino tart.	He who administers a moderate restriction of movement to the patient, with compression by means of bandages or due to concurrent causes and similar conditions, should only do so temporarily.
Mays si aquo endeve ad alcu e no sia le metge present ni medicina, lahoras obre am pausament del dit indic sobre le orrifici de aquela vena ayssi cum havem dit, e entenda a la gran costreccio de lu entro que le sanc sia ostat de la sobirana partida de la plagua, e sobre la arceria le dit no sia remaugut; e de sobre la arceria sia aspergit am aygua frega de mot gran fregiditat entro que·l sanc sia congilat e engrossat; e mays cossire en que ha de cauteri o de medicina necessitat.	If this must be done for anyone and not in the presence of a doctor or medicine, then open at the indicated site on the vein as we have said, and understand the great constriction within that the blood flow is stopped from the sovereign cause of the illness; and on the swelling, it should not be rubbed; and rather, pour cold, wrung water within until the swelling is frozen and thickened; and then consider what cautery or medicine is required.
Comensa la segonda partida.	Begin the second step.
De incisio e perforacio e ventozas e de fleubotomia e de plaguas e de lor semblants.	Regarding incisions, punctures, ventilation, phlebotomy, wounds, and their likes.
Aquestas son paraulas de Albucazis.	These are the words of Albucasis.
Ja havem dit en le primier capitol tota malautia en la qual cauteri am foc es convenient e am medicina comburent, e las occasios e las causas de lu, e les instrumentz en aquels necessaris am las formas dels cauteris; e he ordenatz les capitols de la subiranetat del cap entro als pes.	In the first chapter, we have discussed all manner of illness in which cauterization with fire is appropriate, both medicinally and through burning, along with their occurrences and causes, and the tools required for such as described in the forms of the cautery. I have organized the chapters ascending from the head to the feet.
E yeu procesire en aquest capitol per aquela meteysa guisa, per que sia alliujat lo querent aquo, lahoras sobre aquo que aura demandat.	And in this chapter, we shall proceed in this manner, so that anyone desiring it may find relief, as much as possible on the subject of which he has inquired.
E denant que yeu comense aquo, cove, fils, que aprenguatz que en aquest capitol es per terror aquo que es en le capitol primier de cauterizacio.	And before you begin, understand that this chapter is for those who have learned in the first chapter about cauterization from fear.
E per aquo que cove que sia en lu gran cautela, quar en la operacio la qual es en aquest capitol motas veguadas catz evacuacio la qual es am sanc am le qual esta la vida deves la aspersio de la vena o incisio sobre l’apostema o apercio de exsitura o puracio de la plagua o extraccio de sageta o incizio de peyra e a lor semblantz.	And because you should be in great caution, for in the operation which is in this chapter, one can observe sudden effusion of blood, which is dangerous to life, you must apply the vein or make an incision over the abscess, or perceive the discharge, or clean the wound, or extract the arrow, or begin the treatment of stone and similar things.
E de totz aquels so acompanhatz temor e tremor e en le mas de lor catz la mort.	And from all of these, fear and trembling accompany them, and in most cases, death.
E yeu amonesti vos que sobre vos no caia aquo en le qual es esitacio, quar alcunas veguadas cazo deves vos manieyras de homes am manieyras motas de malautias.	And I warn you that it does not fall on you in which there is a situation, because sometimes you must take the ways of men as the ways of diseases.
E de lor es alcu que s’irays am la sua malautia e es leugiera deves lu la mort, e aysso per la vehemensia de aquo que troba de sa malautia, e per longuesa de la malautia de lu, e am la malautia es paor la qual significa mort.	And of them, some will go to their disease and despite all efforts, death will be denied to them; thus, because of the violence of what he finds in his illness, and due to the longevity of his illness, fear of the disease which signifies death.
E de aquels es le qual dona a tu son aver e ditta, tu esperant am aquel sanetat, e la sieua malautia es perniciosa.	And of these, he who gives you hope and confidence in health, for his disease is deadly.

And therefore, do not be deceived by those who come to you with this manner; let your caution be greater than their knowledge and their greed; and do not presume any cause about it except for certain knowledge that proves what they tell you, and which has received praise in its success.

Use in the treatment of all your patients, from diagnosis and indication of that which brings health, for it assists you in acquiring fame and memory, praise and glory.

E yeu e ordenat aquest capitol distingent per capitols segon que precedit en le capitol de cauteris, de la cura del cap entro als pes, per que sia a vos alleujat aquo que demandatz de aquo e del qual havetz necessitat. Capitol primier.	First Chapter.
De la curacio de aygua la qual es contenguda en le cap dels enfantz.	On the treatment of water contained in the head of children.
Sapias que aquesta malautia motas veguadas endeve als enfantz deves le enfantament e quan la noyrissa estrenh le cap del enfant ses livitat.	You know that this illness often affects children, starting during childbirth and when the darkness enters the child's head, its vitality is affected.

Capitol .iii.	Chapter III.
De extraccio de las arcerias las quals so en las templas.	From extraction of the arteriies which are in the temples.

Capitol .vi.	Chapter VI.
De la cura de aquo que catz en las aurelhas.	On the treatment of what cats have in their ears.
Tota causa que catz en las aurelhas es una de quatre specias, quar o es peyra mineral o causa semblant a peyra, ayssi cum ferr e veyre, o es de planta ayssi cum ceze o fava, o es causa fluxtibla ayssi cum aygua e vi agre e a lor semblantz, o alcuna bestia.
