Capitol .lxix.	Chapter LXIX.
De castracio.	On castration.
Sapias que castratio en nostre ley es excomengada, mays per causa es legut a mi que·m remembre de lu en aquest libre; e no es necessaria la rememoracio de lu sino per doas manieyras, de las quals es la una per so que aquo sia en la sciensa del metge quan es enterroguat de aquela, que sapia la curacio de lu al qual accideys; e l’autra manieyra es que nos motas vetz havem necessitat de castracio de autras bestias per les juvamentz nostres per aquelas, ayssi cum de motos, e de bocs, e de porcs, e de semblantz a las bestias.	You know that castration is forbidden in our law, but for the sake of reminding you in this book, I will speak about it; and the remembrance of it is necessary only in two ways: one, so that when asked about its cure by those who encounter it, the physician may know; and the other, because we ourselves sometimes have need to castrate other animals for our breeding stock, just as with horses, dogs, pigs, and similar beasts.
E donc dic que castracio es fayta en dos manieyras: o per atrissio, o per fissura a seccio.	And thus it is said that castration is performed in two ways: either by constriction or by surgical incision.
Mays en aquela que es fayta per atrissio, la via de la opera es que nos fassam cezer la bestia en aygua cauda entro que·ls genetius de lu sian mollificatz e sian linhitz e que pendan.	In the case of castration by constriction, the surgical procedure involves cutting off the testicles while they are still soft and manageable and allowing them to hang down.
E aprop pren aquels am la tua ma entro que sian resols e no apparescan dejos le tocament.	Then take those with your hand while they are resolved and do not appear to be affected by the touch.
Mays en castracio fayta per fissura e seccio, cove que tu tenguas la bestia e premas la codena dels testicols de lu am la ma senestra.	For castration by surgical incision, hold the animal and with your left hand, press on the cord of its testicles.
E aprop lia le suspensori, e inscideys sobre quascun huou am una seccio entro que dos huous proceseysso.	Then tie the suspension, and cut along each testicle with a section, between two processes.
E aprop inscideys aquels pus que auras quascu excorjat.	And then cut away that pus which you have removed from some place.
E no leysses sobre aquels del ciphac alcuna causa, sino le ciphac subtil le qual es sobre les vazes.	And do not leave any cause over those of the brain, but the subtle illness that is upon the vessels.
E aquesta manieyra de castracio es milhor la qual es fayta per atrissio, quar atrissio fort leu layssa alcuna causa dels testicols per que la bestia desira coyt.	And in this manner of castration, done by compression, is better because it leaves no cause for the testicles, so the animal does not desire to mate.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia sanada.	And then tend to the wound until it is healed.
Capitol .lxx.	Chapter LXX (70)
De la cura de hermafrodozia.	On the cure for hermaphroditism.
Hermafrodozia en les homes es segon dos manieyras: la una es quar o appar en aquo que siec l’espazi en la codena de testiculs, en aquel que es entre dos testiculs figura quar cunh de femna en la qual so pels.	Hermaphroditism in men is according to two manners: one where there appears an issue with the space in the scrotum, in which case it resembles both male and female characteristics, including hair.
E alcunas veguadas de aquel corr urina le qual es en la codena dels testiculs.	And some times, urine flow from that vein in the scrotum.
Mays en las femnas es una specia: e es que·l conh de la femna sobre le pentenilh es ayssi cum dos testiculs de home un pauc de tot yminiheys a la partida deforo ayssi cum le perpucii de home e dos testicols.	In women, it is different: for the womb of a woman over the penis has two ovaries like a man's, slightly smaller in size outside, similarly to the vulva of a man and two ovaries.
E la curacio es de tres specias: de dos dels homes e de una specia de las femnas.	And the treatment is of three kinds: two for men and one for women.
E es que cove que tu inscidas aquelas carns ajustadas entro que efuga la emprecio de aquela, e aprop que cures aquelas am curacio de las autras plaguas.	It is because you must understand the tight flesh between which the discharge of that [disease] escapes, and then treat it with a cure for other ailments as well.
E en la segonda specia dels homes de la qual yeys urina la qual es en la codena dels testiculs, no es curacio ni opperacio en lu.	And in the second kind of men, from whom urine flows from the vein in the scrotum, there is neither cure nor operation for them.
Capitol .xxi.	Chapter 21.
De lentinge e de carn eminent per causas de las femnas.	Of springtime and flesh swelling due to causes related to women.
Lentige fort leu es ajustada sobre causas naturals entro que es etressat e es fayt leg le reguardament; e alcunas veguadas es magnificada en alcunas femnas en tant entro que es spandit ayssi cum en les homes e perve entro al coito.	The swelling of the testes is strictly related to natural causes, as it is affected and can be observed with care; in some cases, it is aggravated in certain women to such an extent that it spreads as in men, and pervades into coitus.
Adonc cove que tu tenguas la superfluitat de lentinge am la tua ma o am unci e inscidas.	Therefore, if you have an excessive accumulation of swelling in the testes with your hand or thumb, and it persists, then dig into it.
E no ultimes en inscizio, majorment en le preon de la razit, per so que no endevengua flux de sanc.	And do not stop digging until you reach the root of the cause, especially in the painful area, so as to avoid any flow of pus.
E aprop cura aquela am curacio de las plaguas entro que sia sanada.	And pay close attention to the treatment for healing the pain, as it is treated.
Mays carn nascuda es carn que nays en le horrifici de la mayre entro que umple aquel, e fort leu es eyssit a las partidas deforo segon semblansa de coa (e per aquo alscus primiers appelero aquo “malautia caudada”); donc cove que nos inscidam ayssi cum inscidem lentinge, e curem aquela entro que sia sanada.	The flesh that is born hidden within the body's folds, until it erupts outside, appears red and swollen (and for this reason they sometimes call it "chronic gout"); therefore we must incise it as we would a tumor, and treat it until it is healed.
Capitol .lxxii.	Chapter LXXII
De curacio de alratica.	**On the Treatment of Goiter**
Alratica es que le conh de la femna no sia perforat, o sia le trauc petit.	Goiter is when the thyroid gland of the female is not properly opened or its passage is blocked.
E es o natural o accidental.	And it is either natural or accidental.
Accidental es per malautia la qual ha precedit, e aquela es fayta o per carn nada ajustada o per ciphac subtil o espes.	Accidental means due to a previous gout, or caused by improperly adjusted flesh, or subtle and thick deposits.

De extraccio del fet quan es mort.	Regarding the removal of what is dead.
Quan tu curas le fet mort am aquo que havem dit en la divisio de la medicacio e no es defora eyssit, e tu yest forsat usar de opperacio am ma, lahoras cove que consideras si la femna es de sana vertut e no es am alcu dels accidentz per les quals sobre ela es temuda perdicio. E·l ministre tengua aquela de doas partz o sia liada en le lieyt per so que·l cos de lu no se extenda deves la extraccio del fet.	And the assistant should hold both parts or be positioned on the bed to prevent his body from extending during the removal of the fetus.

E aprop pause e fique en la apposicio de lu un autre unci, o le tertz si es necessitat, per so que sia atraccio engual, e no sia extencio segon la sua rectetut tant solament. Ans sia maugut a tota partida, per so que l’eyssiment de lu sia alleujat ayssi cum es fayt en dent deves la eradicacio de lu.	And consider everything carefully, so that the projection of it is alleviated as is done in various cases when eradicating it.

Forma de vertitge am la qual es uberta la mayre:	Shape of the lever used to open the womb:
Aquesta es la forma de strenhedor en le qual so engualhatz les libres, al qual engualhament sian dos virtitges en doas extremitatz de dos futz.	This is the form of a stretcher in which the limbs are joined, to which two levers on either end of two feet are attached.
May empero aquesta virtitge cove que sia pus subtil de strictori, e sia fayt o de eba o de fust de boys.	However, this virtue should be applied with great subtlety, either with hot or cold compresses.

De extraccio de la segondina.	From the extraction of the second one.

Forma de instrument am le qual la femna es sub-fumiguada deves la retentio de mestruas e de la segondina:	A device used to induce inhalation for the retention of menstruation and postnatal bleeding:

De curacio de las fistulas que endeveno dejos.	On the treatment of fistulas that have formed.
Las fistulas que endeveno en la partida dejos pus bassa so nodacio e grossetut las quals endeveno prop del cul defora o en l’espazi de la una partida.	Fistulas that develop in the anus or in the space between openings are characterized by a discharge of pus, often accompanied by swelling and pain.
E es una fistula o motas.	And it is either a fistula or a pustule.
E cum aquela nodacio es antiquada e corr de la humiditat aygosa blanca o poyridura subtil, e alcunas veguadas so de aquestas fistulas alcunas penetrantz. E aquo en que es conoguda fistula penetrant entro al cul e no-penetrant, es que tu metas le tieu dit endic en le cul, e entrometas tenta subtil de eram o de ferr en la fistula quan no y es turtuositat.	And in cases where a known fistula penetrates into the anus but does not exit, you should insert the aforementioned finger into the anus and attempt to push or pull the fistula when it is not too tight.
Mays si en aquela es turtuositat, lahoras entromet en aquela tenta subtil de plom o de pels de caval entro que tu sentas la tenta o le pel en le tieu dit.	If it is too tight, then insert the attempt of a gentle push or pull with your finger until you feel the tentation or the hair in the finger that you insert.
E si no sentas aquela de tot ni no procezeys del trauc alcuna causa de egestio ni verm ni ventositat, ayssi cum havem dit, lahoras sapias que es no-penetrant, e lahoras coyta te a la curacio.	And if you do not feel anything at all or there is no sign of expulsion of worms or gas during the treatment, as we have said, then you should know that it is non-penetrant and limit yourself to care.
E quan la fistula es penetrant entro a la vesica o entro al meat de la vergua, lahoras la significacio de lu es eyssiment de urina de aquela e prohibicio de lu ad aysso que·l loc am medicina sia consolidat.	And when the fistula penetrates into the bladder or into the flesh of the penis, then the meaning of it is the expulsion of urine from that area and the prohibition of urination until that location is medically solidified.
Mays si es penetrant entro la junctura de la coyssa o entro al os e envencio de dolor en le circuit, lahoras senhal de lu es que la tenta perve entro aqui si en lu no es turtuositat entro al os, e envencio de dolor en le circuit de la partida; e que de lu yeys poyredura tostemps; e que no val en aquela medicacio, ni es consolidada am enguent.	If it is penetrating within the joint of the thigh or within the bone and causes pain in circulation, its sign is that the pain penetrates here if there is no stiffness within the bone, and causes pain in the entire limb; and it will cause pus perpetually; and it does not respond to treatment, nor is it solidified with ointment.
E en totas aquelas fistulas penetrant no es curacio de tot, e la curacio de aquelas es trebalh e vanetat dels folyls metges sobre·l qual so fermatz.	And in all those penetrating fistulas, there is no complete cure; the cure for those requires hard work and the sensitivity of skilled doctors who heal them.
Mays en aquela que no es penetrant e no antiqua, sanacio am ferr es sperada segon que yeu a tu recomtare, e aquo que ja yeu e proat.	But in those that are not penetrating or recent, healing with iron tools is hoped for according to what you have been advised, and what you have already tried.
E es que le malaute jagua entre las tuas mas sobre le sieu dos e eleva las cambas de lu entro sus, las coyssas sian enclinadas al ventre de lu, e aprop entromet tenta de plom, o de eram si es en la fistula turtuositat, entro que sapias le loc on perve la tenta.	And the illness moves between your legs over its bones and raises the patient's legs within them, the thighs are inclined towards the patient's belly, and then it inserts a probe of lead, or iron if there is stiffness in the fistula, at the place where you know the pain penetrates.
E si aquela sent le malaute entorn le cuol, lahora cove que tu entrometas le tieu dit endic en le cuol.	And if the patient feels pain around the heart, then you must insert your index finger into the chest.
E si sentas en le tieu dit la tenta ja per si meteyssa descuberta penetrar, otra aquo que sentas entre le tieu dit e aquela siphac o carn, lahoras sapias certanament que aquela es penetrant; e adonc no trebalhes en aquela, quar no es en aquela sanacio, ayssi cum havem dit.	And if you feel a sudden heat in the chest already for itself making itself known as discovered, or another thing that you feel between the chest and that sinus or flesh, then you will surely know that it is penetrating; and therefore do not work on that, because there is no healing in that, as we have said.
Mays empero diyssero alcus que es sana en alcus homes tart.	They may still say that it is good for some people, although it may be harmful to others.
E de la medicacio per la qual es sperat juvament en lu es que tu ignes cauteri subtil segon le ample de la fistula, ayssi cum es precedit, e intrometas aquel ignit en la fistula entro que pervengua entorn le cuol; e aprop itera aquel doas o tres vetz entro que sapias que ja son adhustas totas aquelas carns ajustadas fistuladas que so semblantz a cana de pluma de ausel.	And as for the treatment by which recovery is expected in such cases, you must make subtle cauterization according to the extent of the fistula, as mentioned above, and insert that heated instrument into the fistula until it circumvents the chest; and then repeat that two or three times until you know that all those flesh parts around the fistula, which are adjusted like a plume of an ostrich's feather, have healed.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder entro que en yescan totas aquelas carns que so adhustas, e aprop cura aquela am medicinas la carn engendrantz e consolidantz, e si es sanada, bo es; e sino, lahoras no es sana en degun temps per autra curacio.	And then carefully tend to those wounds wrapped in bandages so that all the attached flesh is thoroughly cleaned, and treat them with medicines that heal and strengthen the flesh, and if it heals well; otherwise, it will not heal in any time through other treatments.
E si la tenta intra, e no penetra entro·l tieu dit le qual es en le cul, e entre aquel e la tenta que es velament spes de carn o de ciphac, e vezes la fistula en aquo que siec la superficia de la codena, lahoras secca la codena del comensament de la fistula, e tu ve seccan am la tenta, e sia en la fistula entro que la seccio pervengua al loc en le qual perve la extremitat de la tenta, e per la tenta es liberat e catz.	And if the attempt enters and does not penetrate into the small intestine, but there is a space between it and the attempt, which consists of flesh or closed matter, then open a fistula in that place where the surface of the intestine can be seen, dry the intestines from the beginning of the fistula, and let the attempt dry too; thus, through the attempt, it will be freed and removed.
E aprop mundifiqua aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so asembladas a canula de pena de ausel e no romangua de aquelas alcuna causa.	And then carefully change those fistulated meats that are attached to a hollow tube of foreign origin and not torn for any reason.
Mays si flux de sanc vezes que vengua entre tu e la tua opperacio quan ensideysses aquelas carns, lahoras le milh que sia e del pus leugier instrument es cauterizar am foc o am medicina acuta, quar cauteri am foc ajusta bonas doas habitutz: so es adhustio de aquelas carns ajustadas, e abscizio del sanc exseccacio de las humiditatz.	If the flow of pus appears between you and your operation when you think of those meats, then take a fine tool and cauterize it with fire or sharp medicine, for cautery with fire is good for both: it adjusts those meats attached and cuts off the pus by drying the moisture.
E aprop cura aquela am calguas envolopadas en boder o en caus trissat entro que·l loc geta brac, e aprop lahoras cura la plagua am enguentz carn dura engendran e consolidan.	And then carefully care for those with swollen or irritated tissues around the affected joint until the pain gets better, and treat the sore area with hot compresses to soften hard, inflamed, and consolidating tissue.
E so medicinas en las quals so stipticitat e exseccio; quan lahoras es restaurada ja es sanada e no temes iteracio.	And such medicines which include strictness and restriction; when the pain is restored, it is healed and you need not fear recurrence.
Mays si la fistula ja perve entro al preon del cul e es elonguada de lu superficia del cos, lahoras entromet le tieu dit en le cul e inquireys am aquel.	But if the fistula has already perforated into the anus and is protruding from the surface of the body, then insert a finger into the anus and explore it carefully.
E donc si centes la tenta e entre tu e ela es velament de ciphac o de carn, e es propda a la penetracio, lahora no es operacio en lu sino segon via di fiducia e de speransa.	And therefore if the tumor is hard and between you and it there is merely a thin layer of tissue or flesh, and it is prone to penetration, then it is not an operation on it but rather a matter of trust and hope through another method.
La qual causa es aministrar en lu una de tres manieyras: o que cauterize aquela ayssi cum havem dit; o que secces aquela entro que consieguas la conquavitat de lu per que sia a tu possible entrometre las qualcas e la curacio propdana; e no procesiscas mot am seccio per so que no inscidas le lacert contenent le cuol, e que accidisque sobre le malaute eyssiment de la egistio ses voluntat; e aprop cura aquel am aquo que havem dit quar fort leu sira sanat; o que elongues aquel velament e mondes aquel pus que seccas aquel entro prop le cul, ayssi cum havem dit, o am tenta o am autre instrument de aguda extremitat, e aprop mondifique aquelas carns fistuladas las quals so en la seccio entro la on podes am percrustacio; e aprop esforsa te a far la restauracio de tota la plagua am seccio, e si le orrifici pus desus no es consolidat, e romangua la fistula uberta en la partida del cul, e sira pus leugier per le malaute.	The treatment for which there are three methods: first, cauterizing it as we have mentioned; second, drying it out until you can reach the cavity within to apply the cure; avoid any sharp incision because you do not want to puncture the sac containing the pus and cause further damage, and instead let the patient's own will guide the healing process; then carefully tend to that area as we have said, either by elongating the membrane and draining the pus collected below it near the anus, using a probe or another sharp instrument, or through an attempt or another device of extreme sharpness, and surgically close those incised fistular tissues wherever possible; and finally, make every effort to restore all the affected areas that were cut, and if the incision becomes infected and the fistula opening above remains unhealed, puncture it from the anus and let the pus drain out more gently for the patient's benefit.
E alscunas veguadas la fistula es finida segon aquesta manieyra: es quan tu entrometas la tenta en la fistula, e es en le latz del cul entorn la superficia del cos am la codena e en le marge del cul, lahoras pren tenta de perforada extremitat, que es ayssi cum agulha de preparantz les coers segon aquesta forma:	And in some cases, the fistula is finished in this manner: when you insert the probe into the fistula, it is on the side of the anus near the surface of the body and at the margin of the anus, take the probe with a pointed end, which is thus prepared to pierce the skin in this form:
e entromet en aquela fiel envolopat de v fiels o entorn aquels; e aprop entromet tenta am fiel en la fistula entro que consiegua la conquavitat de lu.	and insert yourself into that wound enveloped in cloth or around those; and then, insert the probe into the fistula until you reach its cavity.
Mays si es penetrant en le marge del cul prop dedintz, lahoras tu extratz le fiel de aquel trauc ayssi que tu intrometas le tieu dit en le cul; e extraguas la extremitat del fiel e ajustes las duas extremitatz essemps, e estrenh cascuna, e leyssa aquo per un dia o per dos, e quan mays inscideys le fiel en la carn, estrenh be aquel entro que aquelas carns sian inscididas las quals so entre doas extremitatz del fiel e que cajan.	If it penetrates deeply into the margin of the anus very close, then extract the probe from that passage as you have inserted the tip inside the anus; remove the end of the probe and align both ends, then open each one, leaving it for a day or two, and whenever you more deeply insert the probe into the flesh, open it when those parts of the flesh are cut between the two ends of the probe and they fit.
E aprop cura la plagua entro que sia consolidada e sanada.	And then treat the wound until it is consolidated and healed.
Mays si le orrifici de la fistula no es penetrant, lahoras fay aquel penetrar, en qualque manieyre sia a tu preparat, sino que sia mot en le preon, quar no es a tu que fassas aquo per que no inscidas le lacert; e aprop fay am aquela entro que sia sanada.	If the opening of the fistula is not penetrating, then make it penetrate in some way that you are prepared, either with heat or cold, as long as it does not cause a laceration; and then treat it until it is healed.
La forma de spatum spinos am lo qual es fenduda la fistula: la curvitat del qual es mot aguda e l’autra partida es no-aguda, per so que no inscidas aquo que no es necessari, ayssi cum vezes.	The shape of the spatulam with which the fistula is divided: its curvature is sharp on one side and the other part is not sharp, so as not to cause unnecessary damage when you use it.
De sutura de emorroydas en las quals corra sanc en la inscizio de aquelas.	Of the stitching of hemorrhoids where pus runs from the incision of those.
Emorroydas so segon dos manieyras, quar o so entre le cul semblantz aysi que es de carbos, o quays aquelas sian cum a gras de rasim.	Hemorrhoids are of two kinds, either they are between the buttocks resembling coal, or those are as if with fat protrusion.
E de aquelas so petitas e grans, e que le sanc corr de aquelas tostemps e es una, e so motas, e so fora·l cul, e en las extremitatz de lu.	And they are small and large, and the sanch [or blood] flows from them at that time in one way, they are numerous, they leave the body, and in the extremities of it.
Mays empero aquelas que so foro le cul so segon las mes de pauca humiditat, de las quals corr aygua citrina o un petit de sanc am cos continuabla, e so segon la color del cos.	However, those that are only open at the anus are according to few humors, of which citron water or a little blood flows continuously, and they are according to the body's color.
E la curacio de aquela que es dedintz le cuol es que comandes al malaute que se assela e que se exprema entro que le cuol yesca e las emoroydas apparescan a tu.	And the treatment for that which is inside the anus is to order the patient to lie down and press until the anus opens and the hemorrhoids appear before you.
Adonc tu te coyte e suspen am uncis o que tenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, e aprop incideys aquelas deves las suas razitz.	Then take care and suspend them with pins or what you have at your disposal, and return the intestines to their roots.
Mays si les uncis no so tengutz en aquelas per la humiditat de lor e mollificacio de aquelas, lahoras pren aquelas am drap aspre o am coto o am flassada de lana, e extratz aquelas am les tieus ditz, e aprop inscideys aquelas e polveriza sobre lor alcunas polveras caudas aprop la inscizio, per que sian ad aquelas en loc de cauteri; o cauteriza aquelas segon que es precedit en le capitol de cauterizar.	If the pins are not held in place by the humidity of their intestines and the softening of those parts, then take a coarse cloth or woolen string and extract them with your fingers, and afterward cut them and sprinkle some powdered substances over them near the incision, so that they adhere to those places instead of cauterization; or cauterize them as mentioned in the previous chapter on cauterization.
E aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And then attend to those other treatments until they are healed.
E si le cul no obezeys a egressio, lahoras cristerisa le malaute am cristeri en le qual sia mordicacio petita, e sia lavat am aquel aquo que es en le cuol e que obezesca a egressio leugierament quan le malaute s’esprem.	If the hernia does not yield to treatment, then crisp the malady with a small incision, wash it with water that is in the abdominal cavity and, gently, try to force it out when the hernia squeezes.
Mays si las emorroydas so defora le cul, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiera, e es que tu prenguas aquelas am la tua ungla, o que prenguas aquelas am unci, e inscidas aquelas, e aprop cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit entro que sian sanadas.	But if the hemorrhoids are outside the anus, their cause is slight, and it is because you take those with your hand or those with wax, and cut them, and then treat them as we have said until they are healed.
E aquel que avoreys inscizio, cove que aministres sutura de lor segon aquesta manieyra: pren fiel envolopat e entromet aquel en agulha e aprop extratz las emorroydas a las partidas dessus, e fay aquel penetrar am la agulha en la razit del autra part, e envolveys las doas extramitatz del fiel en la partida pus dejos de la agulha, e so latitudinalment; e estrenh la emorroyda am strectura fort, e aprop noza le fiel e extratz la agulha.	And for those who perform the incision, know how to apply a suture to them according to this method: take the thread wrapped around and pass it through the needle, pull out the hemorrhoids from the openings above, and make the needle pierce in the opposite direction (from the other side), then wrap both ends of the thread on the side beneath the needle, slightly away from it, and tighten the hemorrhoid with a strong stretch, tie off the thread, and remove the needle.
E fay aquo a totas, e layssa de aquelas una e no la cozes, per so que la superfluitat del sanc corra de aquela.	And do it all at once, leaving none of them untouched, so that the excess of blood flows from it.
E aprop pausa sobre le cul drap enfus en oli rozat o en cerot; e pausa aquel sobre·l cuol e comanda al malaute que·s repause.	Then place your hand on the cloth soaked in hot oil or wax; press it against the affected area and instruct the patient to rest.
E aprop layssa aquela entro que caja; e quan es casuda, cura aquelas am enguentz o am autra curacio entro que sia sanat.	Then remove that cloth and, when necessary, treat the affected area with ointment or other remedies until it is healed.
De curacio de fistulas.	**Curation of Fistulas**
Motas veguadas accideys per exseccacio de fenda o per costriccio de natura.	Various occasions arise due to the drying out of fissures or the constriction caused by nature.
E cum so antiquadas e no val en aquela medicina, lahoras cove que tu razas aquelas am la puncta de spatum o am la tua ungla entro que sian faytas humidas e sia hostada de aquelas la escorsa pus desus, la qual prohibeys aquelas de consolidacio; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian consolidadas.	And since these fissures are old and do not respond to that treatment, you will need to use a pointed instrument or your finger to moisten them and express the purulent discharge, which prevents their hardening; then treat them until they are hardened.
Lahoras tu osta aquelas am razio pus vehement que la primieyra entro que mot sancno e sian excoriadas; e aprop cura aquelas entro que sian sanadas.	Then you should apply those remedies with a strong reason, as the first enters that causes pain and becomes inflamed; and then take care of those that need to be healed.
De curacio de almesamir, so es clau.	The treatment of hernias is crucial.
Sapias que alamermar, so es clau, e no es si no notz redon segon la color del cors semblant a cap de claviel, e es fayt en tot le cors e majorment en las partidas dejos les pes e als ditz, e endeve per aquels dolor deves le anament.	You know that hernia, it is crucial, and it is not recognized if it does not appear according to the color of the body, resembling a bone head, and it occurs throughout the body and most notably in the groin and sides, and for these pains you should pay attention.
E adonc cove que sia inscidit aquo que es en le circuit del clau, e sia tengut am les forfexs o am unci, e sia eradicat de la sua razit; e aprop cura aquel.	And so it is necessary to incise what is in the region of the hernia, and hold it with forceps or a hook, and eradicate it from its place; and then take care of that.
E si vols, cauteriza le segont que es precedit en le sieu capitol.	And if you wish, apply cautery as mentioned previously in its chapter.
Mays de veruca es eminencia petita aspre fistulada redonda sobre la superficia del cos, e motas veguadas veno en las mas dels enfantz.	May a verruca be a small, rough, round ulceration on the surface of the body, often appearing in children.
E curacio de lu es que estendas e inscidas aquela, o que estrenhas aquela am fiel o am pel entro que caja.	And the treatment for it is to extend and incise that, or to open it with a sharp tool or within a container.
E si vols, cauteriza aquo, segon que havem dit, am foc o am medicina acuta.	And if you wish, cauterize it with fire or sharp medical tools.
E ja so eradicadas enversas e no-enversas am le instrument le qual yeu diyre.	And such warts are eradicated with the instrument you have mentioned.
Mays formica es eminencia petita feutrada o fistulada grossa sobre la superficia del cos anant mot en le preon, e quan le freg atroba aquela es centit en lu semblant de mordificacio de formigua, e es fayta entorn le cos.	A mouse (formica in this context) is a small, feigned or fistulated lump on the body's surface, often appearing red, and when pressed, it feels like a mouse bite, affecting the area around it.
E curacio de lu es que prenguas una canula de pena de auca o de pena de voltor, e sia fort, e pausa aquela sobre la formigua entro que la contengua le cercle de la canula de las partidas de lu; e aprop revolveys la tua ma am la canula entro que inscidas aquo que es en le circuit de la formigua, e pauses aquela en le preon de la carn, e que eradiques la formigua de la sua razit.	And the treatment for it is to take a sharp needle from a bird of prey or a serpent, make it strong, and press it onto the mouse among the circle of the needle; then turn your hand over the needle as you cut what is in the path of the needle, and place it on the flesh at the point of the mouse's origin, eradicating the mouse from its source.
E si vols, fay aquo am canula de eram o de ferr segon aquesta forma:	And if you wish, make this as a tube of horn or iron in this manner:
Sia la partida desus de la canulha trahent a subtilitat, sorda (so es no-perforada), envolopada per so que sobre le dit la aprencio de lu sia ablaviada e la revolucio de aquela.	The beginning of the tube should be delicate, soft (not perforated), wrapped around itself so that when it is positioned over the affected part, its movement is not hindered.
E si vols cauteriza la formiga segon que es denant dit en la cauterizacio de atheyl en le capitol de cauteri.	And if you wish to cauterize the wound as mentioned above in the chapter on cauterization, do so according to the method described for cauterizing a wound.
De forma dels instrumentz que so aministratz a dar cristeri.	In the form of instruments used for administering cryotherapy.
Alcunas veguadas es fayt cristeri de argent o de lato o de eram fondut o malleat; e alcunas veguadas es fayt de aquels instrumentz petit e gran segon aquels als quals so aministratz, quar aquel que es aministrat en la curacio dels petitz enfants sia petit; e de aquel dels quals los culs son freuls o doloyrozes, les cristeris de aquels sian petitz.	Sometimes cryotherapy is administered using silver or iron tools that have been melted or shaped; and sometimes it is done with small or large instruments according to those used for the treatment of small children, and for those who have a weak or sensitive constitution, the cryotherapies should be small.
La forma de cristeri gran e pauc:	The method for making a large and few incisions:
Le cap de la canula de lu desus en le qual es liada la borsa sia ampla segon aquesta manieyra; e sia a lu distinacio la on la borsa es liada ayssi cum vezes.	The upper part of the bag should be wide according to this manner, and its distinction is where the bag is tied in the first place with several times.
E la extremitat de lu pus dejus, la qual es entromesa en le cul, sia sorda (so es no-uberta) mot leon, atrasent a subtilita; e en la un del latz de lu sian dos traucs, e en l’autre costat un trauc, e sia la amplesa del trauc segon la groseza dels rays e pus gros un petit.	And the lower end of it, which is inserted into the anus, should be smooth (not covered) with lion's fur, gently attached; and on one side of its length there are two channels, and on the other side one channel, and the width of the channel depends on the thickness of the rays and can be slightly narrowed.
E sia la borsa en la qual sian pausadas las medicinas de vesica de bestia o de pel de ovelha, e la razit de lu sia un palm.	And the bag in which animal bladder or sheepskin medicines are stored should have a length of one palm.
E sia perforada per motz traucs ayssi cum es revolvuda; e si l’espazi le qual es entre les traucs la grossetut del dit.	And it should be perforated through many channels, as it is twisted; and the space between the channels should be as thick as said.
E aprop entromet en aquels traucs fiel fort de fiel cru le qual sia de detz fiels, o enviro aquels; e ajusta am aquel la borsa; e quan es pausada en lu la borsa, sia streyt en le cap del cristeri entre dos distingentz am fort costriccio, e aprop cristeriza am aquel quascun trauc: Mays la qualitat de cristerizar am aquel es que tu omples la borsa de la medicina, que sia escalfada segon la quantitat de la tolleransa del malaute; e guarda te que no sia trop cauda ni trop freja.	And then carefully insert into those channels a strong thread of crude gall, or surround them with it; adjust the bag to that; and when the bag is paused in its place, tighten it at the top of the channel between two distinct points at firm compression, and carefully fasten that channel: The quality of fastening that channel is to fill the bag with medicine, heated according to the amount of the patient's tolerance, and be careful not to make it too tight or too loose.
E aprop le malaute sia resupinat sobre le sieu dos, e eleva las suas cambas en sus e pausa dejos lu un cuer sobre le qual ja so les homes o un lansol; e aprop unta la extramitat del cauteri am oli o am album de huou o am mucellage de fenugrec o de semblantz; e aprop entromet aquel en le cul am facilitat, e aprop le ministre prengua la borsa e exprema aquel am doas mas e essemps am vehemencia entro que sia evacuat en le budelh tot aquo que es en le cristeri; e aprop extra le cristeri e le malaute leva las suas cambas a la paret.	Then have the patient lie on their back, elevate their legs on either side, and place a cushion under them so that they rest upon it; then apply the tip of the cautery with oil or egg albumen or mucilage of fenugreek or similar to the anus with ease, and have the minister take hold of the bag and squeeze it twice as hard as possible so that everything within the channel is evacuated into the intestine; then remove the cautery and have the patient raise their legs against the wall.
E si la medicina forsa aquel a eyssiment, tengua le tant quant poyra; e si dorm am aquel per tota una nueyt, es mays derier en juvament.	And if the medicine forces vomiting, take as much as you can; and if he sleeps through it all night, it is more beneficial for recovery.
Mays si tu cristerizas aquel en las malautias de solucio de ventre e l’eyssiment de lu le coyta, lahoras tu itera le cauteri entro que sia sanat.	If you apply your knowledge to the solutions of intestinal problems and vomiting, and the condition improves, then you repeat the cauterization until it is healed.
E si en le cul so emorroydas o apostemas ledens, lahoras sia le cristeri mot subtil e leon, dels cristeris am les quals les enfantz so criterisatz.	And if there are hemorrhoids or fissures in the anus that cause pain, then use a gentle and subtle cauterization, with small instruments that children use to cut them.
De curacio de las plaguas.	**Curation of Plagues**
Yeu ja e dit en la divisio de la curacio de las plaguas aquo que convenia al libre, e yeu dic assi la curacio de aquelas am ma e am medicinas segon le conpliment.	You have already mentioned in the discussion of plague cure what suits the body, and you have also given the cure for some from both arts and medicine according to their perfection.
Donc dic que las plaguas son diversificadas segon aquo en que son faytas las plaguas e segon le loc sobre le qual cazo las plaquas.	Therefore, it says that plagues are diversified according to where they are produced by the plagues and according to the place on which the plague strikes.
E las causas per que motas vetz son faytas las plaguas so ayssi cum getament de peyra, o inscisio d’espaza o de cotel, o percussio am lansa, o am fustz, o am sageta, o semblantz ad aquels de motas causas.	And the causes for which diseases arise are also diverse, such as the inflammation of a wound, or an incision of space or skin, or striking with a lance, or a club, or an arrow, or similar to those disease-causing factors.
Mays las plaguas que so en les locz del cos so ayssi cum plagua la qual catz sobre le cap, o·l col, o·l pietz, o·l ventre, o·l fitge, e semblantz ad aquels dels membres.	The diseases that are in the parts of the body can also be such as a plague which strikes on the head, or the collarbone, or the foot, or the belly, or the chest, and similar to those members.
E yeu so recomtant la curacio de alcunas plaguas per que pauses aquela ratiocinacio e regla sobre las autras plaguas.	And it is often recommended for the treatment of certain diseases to stop that reasoning and regulate over other diseases.
E yeu comensare de las plaguas del cap simplas, quar la rememoracio de las compostas vindra al comensament del tertz capitol.	And one should begin with simple diseases of the head, since the remembrance of the compounded ones will come at the commencement of the third chapter.
Donc dic que quan accideys en le cap plagua simpla e no es fractura, lahoras considera: si es per getament de peyra o de semblant, e ja ha trinquada la codena tant solament e es gran plagla e temes sobre aquel malaute havinement de apostema caut, lahoras tu te coyta e fleubotoma la cephalica tantost, e no tardas aquo; e extrats ad aquel del sanc segon la quantitat de la vertut de lu si no mes alcuna causa prohibent de fleubotomia, majorment si·l sanc que es eyssit de la plagua es pauc.	Therefore, it is said that when a simple headache occurs and it is not a fracture, consider: if it is due to tension or similar symptoms, and the patient has already taken enough medication and it is a severe headache and you fear the progression of the disease towards abscess, then you should immediately perform a cerebral puncture and drain the fluid, and do not delay; extract the pus from the sinus according to the amount of virtue in it if there is no other contraindicating cause for a cerebral puncture, especially if the sinus that has formed from the headache is small.
E sia la flaubotomia del contrari de la partida plaguada; e guardase le malaute de replecio e de vi e de viandas grossas.	And cerebral puncture is the opposite of the treated condition; and attention must be paid to the patient's diet, as well as avoiding heavy meals.
Mays si de la minuicio prohibeys alcuna causa, lahoras sia aminorat de la vianda e no apropinque a carn ni a vi.	If, however, any cause prohibits the procedure, then reduce the diet and do not bring close meat or wine.
E pausa sobre la plagua, si a lu accideys apostema caut, coto enfus en oli rozat solet o en vi en le qual es stipticat.	And regarding the abscess if it is a cautious apoplexy, apply hot oil or wine in which the patient has been dipped to it.
Mays si est segur de apostema caut, lahoras pausa sobre la plagua, si es recent am le sieu sanc e le ayre no ha mudat aquela la polvera la qual yeu recomtare aprop petit.	If you are certain of the abscess, then apply over it, if recent, its sanification and the air has not altered the powder which I will describe, then gently press.
E si le ayre ja ha mudada aquela, lahoras pausa sobre alscus enguentz entro que sia sanada.	And if the air has already altered it, then apply certain ointments until it is healed.
Mays si la plagua es gran o es per inscizio d’espaza e de semblantz, e no so ajustadas las labias de lu per puvils, lahoras ajusta aquelas am sutura segon que yeu recomtare de la sutura de lor.	But if the abscess is large or for the opening of a space and similar, and its lips are not suitable for sealing due to their condition, then adjust them by suturing according to what I will describe about their suture.
Mays si la plagua ja es discuberta del os e pen, e no es retencio de lu sino un petit suspensori, lahoras inscideys aquela e aprop cura la plagua am medicinas e restaura la carn aprop en loc de codena, e comanda al malaute que sia pescut de viandas en las quals es groceza: caps e formen coyt e semblantz a lor, entro que sia compost.	If the abscess is already exposed from bone and tissue, and it is not a retention but a small suspensory, then incise it and treat the abscess with medicines and restore the flesh appropriately in place of the wound, and instruct the patient to abstain from foods that are coarse: fruits and vegetables and things of similar shape and appearance, until it heals.
E si atrobas en la codena putrefaccio e no adhereys al os, lahoras tu inscideys tot aquo poyrit e geta aquo, e aprop cura aquo.	And if you find a bone decayed and not attached to the flesh, cut off all the rotted parts and remove them, and then care for it.
Mays si en aquestas plaguas es arteria o vena de la qual fluxs de sanc pot evenir, e no es abscindida per medicinas, lahoras tu inquier sobre la arteria, e si atrobas aquela no-inscidida, lahoras tu inscideys aquela am spatum, o lia aquela; e si necessitat te provoca que aquo que havem dit no comfereys, lahoras tu cauteriza entro que·l sanc sia abscidit.	If these plagues are caused by an artery or vein from which pus flows and it is not drained by medicines, then you should investigate the artery. If you find one that is not incised, cut into it with a knife, or tie it off; and if cauterization is required to prevent further discharge after draining the pus, do so.
E si aquestas plaguas son simplas e petitas, lahoras la causa de lor es leugiere; enayssi que tu polverizas sobre aquelas aquesta polvera, quar consolidada aquela denant que l’ayre mude aquelas.	And if these plagues are simple and small, their cause should be considered minor; so you sprinkle over them this powder, as it hardens before the air changes those.
E la manieyra de la polvera es aquesta: recipe oli de enses partida una, de sanc de drago partida doas, de caus no-extincta partidas tres; sia tot mot trissat e crivellat, e de lu sia la plagua omplida, e sia constrengida per bona constriccio entro que be sobre aquela aderesca, e sia coagulada am le sanc.	The method for the powder is as follows: mix equal parts of oil from crushed cloves, dragon's blood, and unextinct caustics; grind it all together finely and fill the plague with it, compressing it tightly so that it sticks to the affected area, and coagulate the pus.
E aprop strengeys aquela desus am pulvils e leyssa aquela, e no la deslias mentre esta ayssi que no es apostemada, quar no es eredicada de lu la medicina entro que sia sanada.	And then tighten it over the poultice and leave it, do not remove it while it is still wet, as medicine does not adhere to it until it is healed.
E alcuna vetz fa aquo sola cautz, quan no es a tu en present enses e sanc de drago.	And at other times it requires only this cautery, when there is no acute pain or inflammation of the dragon.
E ja fa aquesta meteyssa operacio en las grans plaguas quan conveneys que sia pausada sobre aquelas e sian streytas, e so plaguas recentz am le lor sanc, las quals le ayre no ha alteradas.	And this surgical procedure is also carried out on large abscesses when it is appropriate to stop them from opening and tighten them, and they are fresh wounds with their own inflammation, whose air has not been altered.
E si le ayre las ha alteradas, e majorment quan es en temps d’estiu, lahoras no es entencio a la posicio de aquesta polvera, mays adonc cura aquelas am aquo que havem dit, enayssi que tu pauses sobre aquelas alcus enguents degistius, o que pauses sobre aquelas pols de la farina del ordi am aygua e mel entro que getan poyredura; e aprop cura aquelas am l’autra curacio entro que sian sanadas.	And if the air has been altered, especially in summer, then you should not apply this poultice to its position but rather treat them with what we have said, either by placing a paste of herbs mixed with water and honey on them until they become rotten; and then treat them with other remedies until they are healed.
Mays si accideys am la plagua fractura en os, e es petita, lahoras tu extratz aquo am gesti.	If a fracture occurs in a bone, and it is small, then you extract it with your fingers.
E yeu diyre la cura de las fracturas del cap en aquo que es envenidor.	And tell the treatment for fractures of the head that are dangerous.
De las plaguas del col.	Of the ailments of the collarbone.
Mays si la plagua accideys en le col, lahoras no es en lu differencia en medicacio, e entre la plagua del cap quan es simpla.	If the fracture occurs in the collarbone, its treatment does not differ much from other fractures; however, it is more delicate than a simple fracture of the skull.
Mays si ja le nervi del col es inscis o arteria, lahoras si es nervi, no es en lu engen sino que sia evitada curacio de lu am aquo que fa vehement stipticitat, ayssi cum ziniar e zegi que es vetriol e semblantz a lor quar nozo als nervis e contrazo aquel.	If the nerves or arteries of the collarbone are injured, then, if it is a nerve, the treatment should not be aggressive but rather to avoid any cure that causes severe pain; thus, applying liniments and bandages as if they were vitriol, similar to those used for nerve injuries.
E no pauses sobre la plagua alcuna causa de tot freja, quar la sustancia dels nervis es freja e la continuacio de lu es am le cervel, le qual es le pus aut de totz les membres.	And do not place any cause on the plague, for the substance of the nerves is affected and its continuity to the brain, which is the source of all members.
E si’ aquo am que es curat de medicinas leugieras, ayssi cum es caus lavada am aygua dousa, alcuna veguada enfusa en oli rozat o no-rozat, e thucia quan es lavada am aygua dousa e las autras peyras minarantz segon aquesta manieyra, e enguentz humitz.	And if this is to be treated with lighter medicines, then wash it with water twice, sometimes with rosewater or not, and apply heat when washed with water and the other remedies are applied according to this manner, and cover with moisture.
Mays si la plagua es gran, lahoras aministra sutura, o coarta las labias de lu, e aprop cura aquela am pulvils entro que sia sanada.	But if the plague is great, then apply a suture, or tighten the lips of it, and return care to it with powders until it is healed.
Mays si a la plagua es profunditat o accideys en lu a la pus bassa partida poyredura, lahoras perfora aquela en le loc mays depremegut.	But if the plague is deep or occurs in it with a low-breaking pus, then pierce it in the most sensitive place.
Mays si en la plagua ja es inscisa arteria e es conseguit flux de sanc, lahoras separa o secca aquela, o lia aquela, o cauteriza aquela si necessitat te provoca ad aquo.	But if in the plague an artery is already incised and blood flow results, then separate or dry it, or tie it, or cauterize it if necessity requires it.
Mays si ja ha insciditz les spondils del golayro o tot, e so salvadas las venas del col, lahoras tu ajusta las labias de la codena am sutura sobre la cana del golayro e no toques aquel; abantz egala aquel e reduzeys aquel sobre la sua figura natural, e aprop strenh aquel am strectura decent, e leyssa aquela per alcus jorns; e aprop cura aquel am enguentz en les quals es stipticitat e excitacio entro que sia sanat.	If you have already incised the spine of the gutter or completely through, and the veins of the collar are saved, then adjust the lips of the wound with sutures on the canal of the gutter and do not touch it; equalize it and return it to its natural shape, and then tighten that with decent tension, leaving it for a few days; and then treat it with ointment in which there is stiffness and excitement until it heals.
Mays si la plagua ja en le os a fayta enprecio, lahoras percuireys aquela, e lahoras si en lu ha fragmentz de hos, extratz totz aquels que podes de lor; e aquo que a tu no es apparelhat, leyssa aquo entro que la plagua se poyrisca, e sia separat e la egrecio de lu sia alleujada.	If the plague has already taken hold within the bones, then pierce it, and if there are any fragments of foreign bodies, remove all that you can from them; leave what is not appealing to you within until the plague dies down, separates, and is removed from it.
E si la plagua es recent lahoras polveriza sobre aquela polvera la qual t’e recomtada.	And if the plague is recent, then sprinkle that powder which has been recommended to you over it.
Mays si en la plagua es fayta fistula, lahoras cura aquela am aquo del qual la rememoracio vindra aprop en le sieu capitol.	If the plague has caused a fistula, then treat it with water from which the memory of its origin will come in due time, in its proper chapter.
De las plaguas del col o de semblantz quan fayta entre las spallas e es fayta am spaza o am cotel o am lansa o am semblantz.	From the plagues of the collar or similar, when pain strikes between the shoulders and is felt in space or at the edge or with a lance or similarly.
Si es percussio de lansa o de cotel, e vezes de lu la profunditat, lahoras considera mays si de la plagua yeys ventositat quan le malaute elena; lahoras sapias que la plagua es mortal.	If it is a lance or a sword that caused the wound and the depth of it indicates a severe injury, consider more carefully if the plague has an open wound (or an ulcer) when examining the patient; then you will know that the plague is deadly.
E si en lu no es profunditat e la plagua es recent am le sieu sanc, lahoras tu pauses en lu de la primieyra horo polvera, e no strenhas aquel per que no sia le sanc retengut en la profunditat de lu e que retorne al cor e que aucigua le malaute, mays pausa en lu enguent atractiu, e deslia aquela doas veguadas le dia.	And if there is no depth to the wound and the plague is recent, then you should apply powder to it in the first hour; do not tighten that bandage so as to prevent the pus from returning to the depths of the wound and harming the patient more, rather apply a poultice attractive to the wound, and repeat this process twice daily.
E si l’enguent no es a tu present, lahoras tu pausa en le orrifici de la plagua coto viel per que sucque aquo que yeys de las humiditatz; e fay que le malaute dorma sobre la plagua per que corra aquo que es en lu ajustat.	And if a suitable poultice is not available, then apply cut vegetables to the wound's surface to draw out fluid; and make the patient sleep on the wound so that the juices flow freely from it.
Mays si ja de la plagua son passatz tres dias o mays e no accideys al malaute spasme ni tremor de cor mal ni strictura de ale, e vezes las autras dispozicios bonas de lu, lahoras sapias que plagua es salva; e adonc cura aquela am calguas e am l’autra curacio entro que sia sanada.	If the illness has passed three days or more without causing spasms or tremors of the heart, or tightness of the chest, and other favorable dispositions appear, you will know that the illness is cured; then treat those who are still ill until they are healed.
Mays si la sanacio de lu es excusada, e ja tot temps es uberta, lahoras sapias que ja es fayta fistula; cura donc aquela per le sieu capitol.	If the healing of the illness is prolonged, and it remains open for a long time, you will know that a fistula has formed; then treat it according to its nature.
E si la plagua es per inscisio de spaza o de cotel, e es simpla en la superficia del pietz o del dos, lahoras cura aquela am aquo que es precedit de sutura, si es gran, o am polvera, si es petita.	And if the illness is due to a wound or cut in the joint or muscle, and it is simple on the surface of the foot or back, then treat it with stitching if it is large, or with powder if it is small.
Mays si ja ha fayta enprecio en le os, e so ja de lu inscizas pessas, lahoras tu torqua la plagua e coyta ad extrayre aquelas pessas, si so separadas.	If the illness has affected the bones, and there has been an incision in the joints, then you should compress the illness and pull out the detached parts, if they are separate.
Mays si no so separadas, lahoras leyssa las entro que se poyresca la plagua, que la extraccio de lor es alleujada.	If they are not separated, leave them as they are until the plague can be removed, for their extraction is alleviated.
E de las autras plaguas accidentz en les autres membres le juvament en curacio es le juvament de aquo que havem dit.	And for other accidents affecting the other parts of the body, the young treatment in healing is the same as what we have said.
De las plaguas del ventre.	Of abdominal ailments.
L’indisposicio la qual accideys en le ventre es o gran, o pauc, o migiera.	The condition that occurs in the abdomen is either great, or slight, or moderate.
De la gran alcunas veguadas yeys le budel o nervi del budel, per que es fayta intromissio de lor e la sutura de lor esser pus vehement e pus subtil.	For severe cases, the intestine or hernia wall is seen, so that their intrusion and stitching must be powerful and precise.
E disrupcio petita es fayta dificil per autra manieyra, e siec se que la reduccio de lor es pus dificil, si no te coytes de la intromissio de lor al sieu loc tantost, quar se ubre e es engrossat per que le intrament de lu es fayt difficil.	And minor disruptions are difficult to achieve in another manner, and I note that their reduction is more difficult if you do not promptly introduce them to their place, as it opens and swells, making their insertion difficult.
E donc la milhor disrupcio es migiera, quar en aquela no es dificil la reduccio del budel, ayssi cum es dificil en las doas specias denant ditas.	And therefore the best disruption is to lie down, for in this position it is not difficult to return the intestine to its place, as it is difficult with both of the aforementioned types.
E sapias que sutura del ventre es segon quatre manieyras, mays doas suturas son comunas que conveneysso en suturas de las autras plaguas del cors.	And you should know that the suturing of the abdomen is done in four ways, but two sutures are common to all other wounds of the body.
E duas autras suturas proprias comunican a las autras plaguas, mays empero so mays proprias en la sutura del ventre.	And the other two sutures communicate with other wounds, but nonetheless they are more proper for the suturing of the abdomen.
E yeu recomti a tu quascuna am exposicio e declaracio.	And I recommend to each of you exposure and declaration.
Donc dic que quan la plagua es petita e es eyssit alcuna causa del budel per aquela, e es fayt dificil a reduzir aquel, lahoras aquo es en una de doas manieyras: o per parvitat de la disrupcio ayssi cum havem dit, o quan al budel es venguda inflacio per la frigiditat de l’ayre.	Therefore, it says that when the wound is small and there is no cause in the intestine for it to protrude, and it becomes difficult to reduce, then this is in one of two ways: either because of the lack of disruption as we have said, or when the intestine has become swollen due to the coldness of the air.
E donc quan aquo es ayssi, lahora cove que tu scalfes aquel enayssi que tu submerges una sponga ho drap humit en aygua tebeza sola, o que coguas en aygua squinant, e cyperum, e spic, e embroques am aquela le budel entro que la imflacio sia resolvuda.	And therefore when this occurs, you should know that you need to soak that which you immerse in a sponge or cloth moistened in warm water, or take water with sand, or gravel, and wrap it around the hernia until the inflammation is resolved.
E alcunas veguadas fa aquo vi en le qual ha stipticitat, e es milhor que la aygua sola en resolucio de la imflacio.	And in some cases, they use a solution of vinegar and water, which is better than just water in resolving the inflammation.
E donc cum tu vezes la imflacio esser resolvuda, lahoras tu humecta le budel am aygua en la qual es coyta altea e malvas, quar per aquo es alleujat le intrament de lu am pauca causa.	And when you see that the inflammation is resolved, then moisten the hernia with water containing high amounts of aloe and mullein, for it removes the pain from it slightly.
Mays si es escusat le intrament de lu aprop aquesta curacio, lahoras scindeys la disrupcio un petit am strument am le qual so inscididas emorroydas.	But if the pain is completely gone after this treatment, then cut the disruption with a small instrument with which hemorrhoids are incised.
E la curacio primieyra es milhor, quan es propriada que no es seccio, e no sia occupacio a seccar aprop necessitat e defaliment.	And the first treatment is better when it does not involve cutting, and there is no need to apply excessive heat or starvation.
Del instrument, sec se la forma de lu:	Of the instrument, consider its form:
La una partida de lu torta aguda, e l’autra partida no-acuta, e la extremitat subtil, e no sia am la subtilitat de spatum, abantz sia obtusa un pauc.	In one part of the sharp sword, and the other part not sharp, and the tip is slightly blunt, but it's not due to lack of sharpness of the blade.
E donc cum la plagua es amplificada e yeys fora le budel, lahoras cove que la sua reduccio sia segon la forma de lu natural, en le sieu loc propri, si es possible sobre aquo, quar milhor es.	And therefore when the hernia is enlarged and has protruded, it should be reduced to its natural form in its proper place, if possible over that, because it is better.
Mays quan la disrupcio es ampla, e es en la partida pu bassa del ventre, lahoras cove que tu fassas jazer le malaute sobre le sieu dos, e pausa las suas cambas pus autas que·l sieu cap; e si es en la partida pus desus del ventre, lahoras tu pause le cap de lu e·l pietz pus autz que las partidas dejos.	If the hernia is extensive and located in the lower part of the abdomen, you should make the patient lie on their back, and raise their legs higher than their head; but if it is located higher up in the abdomen, you should raise the patient's head and foot higher than the hernial openings.
E semblantment si la disrupcio es en una de las doas partz del ventre, lahoras pausa la tua entencio e la tua consideracio tostemps en aysso per que la partida en la qual es la plagua sia pus auta que l’autra.	And similarly if the hernia is in one of the two parts of the abdomen, you should pause your intention and consideration for a moment so that the opening in which the disease is located is higher than the other.
E ayssi cove que tu aministres aquo en las plaguas grans e en las plaguas migieras.	And thus it is that you must administer this in both great and minor ailments.
E en las plaguas petitas, pausa aquo que es a tu preparat, e aprop fay que·l ministre sia entre las tuas mas pyatados, le qual tengua la disrupcio tota am la sua ma e ajusta las labias de lu, e aprop descuebre de aquela ad aquel que siec la sutura alcuna causa aprop autra.	And in minor ailments, apply what you have prepared, and then make the medicine be administered between your patient's thighs, where it has its origin entirely in their hands, and adjust the lips of it, and then carefully examine from one side to another, seeking any cause that might be hidden, other than the suture.
E aquesta es la manieyra de sutura comuna: una que prenguas la agula, o comte de agula segon la cantitat de la amplitut de la plagua; e aprop layssa de la extremitat de la disrupcio del dit anular, e strenh la agula una, otre que tu no metas fiel en las doas extremitatz de la codena, am doas extremitatz del ciphac que es dejos la codena de las partidas dedintz, entro que fassas aquela penetrar de aquela partida; e tu ja has agreguadas doas extremitatz de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, e so faytas quatre ordes.	And this is the common method of suturing: take the needle, or count one needle according to the quantity of the width of the wound; then lay it near the extremity of the tear on the little finger, and tighten the needle once, but do not insert both ends of the thread into both extremities of the cord, leaving the cord free within, except that you cause the thread to penetrate from one side to the other; thus you have added both extremities of the cord and both extremities of the phalange, making four orders.
E aprop strenh am fiel doble en le circuit de la agula, e alcunas veguadas de doas partz ensemps, e aprop agregua las doas labias e la plagua per agreguacio decent; e aprop layssa la grossitut del dit e fiqua una autra agulha en aquela, e aprop lia aquela am fiel ayssi cum fiest am la primieyra agulha; e no cesses far aquo si es necessitat am las agulhas entro que ajas complida tota la contriccio de la plagua.	And then carefully tighten the thread double around the needle, sometimes from both sides together, and add the two lips and the wound by a decent addition; and leave the thickness of the thread and attach another needle to it, just as if it were the first needle; and do not stop doing this until you have filled all the contraction of the wound with needles.
E sian las agulhas migieras entre groceza e subtilitat, quar las agulhas subtils mot leugierament insciden la carn; e las grossas so de dificil intrament en la codena, e donc per aquo cove que sian migieras en subtilitat e grosseza.	And the needles should be of varying thicknesses, between coarse and fine, for the finer needles cut into the flesh more gently; and the thicker ones are difficult to insert into the skin, hence it is necessary that they be both fine and coarse.
E no cove que la agulha sia ficada en doas extremitatz de la codena propdana mot, per so que la carn no sia inscidida leugierament e que la plagua se huebra devant la sua consolidacio.	And it is necessary that the needle be placed in both ends of the hernia gently, so that the flesh is not cut too deeply and the hernia opens before its consolidation.
E no sian prolonguadas de sutura per que la plagua no sia prohibida de consolidacio.	And the stitches should not be too long so that the hernia is not blocked from healing.
E aprop inscideys las extremitatz de las agulhas per so que no ledescan le malaute deves le sieu dormier; e pausaras sobre la sutura pulvils expanduts de tota partida, les quals tenguan las extremitatz de las agulhas; e layssa aquelas entro que sapias que la plagua ja es consolidada.	And then insert the ends of the needles so that they do not pierce the patient during their sleep; place pillows over the incision on all sides, which have the ends of the needles; and leave them there until you know that the disease is healed.
E aquestas specias de sutura am agulhas en cal manieyra es pus convenient en las plaguas petitas, quar habasta en la sutura de lor una agulha o doas o entorn aquelas.	And these types of suture have needles in a certain way that is most convenient for small wounds, where just one needle or two are enough to close the wound.
Mays la segonda sutura es cominal: e es que tu aministres am sutura las quatre extremitatz, de la codena e doas extremitatz del ciphac, en una veguada, am agulha en la qual sia fiel envolopat engual en subtilitat e grosseza.	However, the second type of suture is as follows: you administer a suture to all four extremities, from the tailbone and two extremities of the thigh, at once, with an needle in which thread is tightly wrapped, both in fineness and thickness.
E aprop quan am la agulha auras penetrat aquestas quatre extremitatz, reduzeys la agulha de aquela meteyssa partida de la qual comensest, per so que le fiel retrayt caja de la pus subirana partida a la plagua, per so que la sutura sia segon sutura de drap am la qual les draps so strengutz.	And then, when you have penetrated these four extremities with the needle, return the needle to its original entry point from which you began, so that the thread retracts and draws the wound closed, making the suture like a drape in which the drapes are tightly bound.
E pausa entre quascuna sutura la quantitat del gros del dit mendre.	And between each stitch, apply enough of the poultice to the thicker part of the finger.
E aquesta sutura sabo les homes.	And this stitch is known to men.
E am tal sutura yeu cozegui la plagua la qual era accidida a un home en le sieu ventre le qual era stat plaguat am un cotel, e era la disrrumpcio de la plagua major de un palm, e era eyssit dels budels entorn dos palms del budel del mieg loc e era la disrupcio en le mieg del membre; e adonc yeu reduzegui aquel depus que le budel havia stat foro la plagua per xxiiii horas.	And I have used this stitch to treat a man who had been struck by a sword in his belly, where the wound was about the size of a palm and located around two palms below the navel; it was a rupture in the middle part of the intestine. And after twenty-four hours, I reduced that swelling that had formed due to the wound.

Mays si es un gran os ayssi cum le os de camba o de coyssa o semblantz ad aquels, e aquo que de lu es corromput es la facia de lu tant solament, lahoras ratz aquela am resio tant solament derriera entro que sia ostada aquela negror e corrupcio, e aprop restaura la plagua.	If it is a large bone such as the femur or thighbone or similar, and what is corrupted of it is only the surface, then quickly apply this medicine just enough behind that dark and corrupted area, and soon restore the wound.
Mays si aquo que de lu es corrumpyt es gran partida, e la corrupcio ja ha conseguida la medulla del os, lahoras es causa necessaria cerrar aquel e aquel tot inscidir entro al loc on es pervenguda la corrupcio, e lahoras cura aquel entro que sia consolidada.	If the part that is corrupt is extensive, and the corruption has already reached the marrow of the bone, then it becomes necessary to completely cut out that part within the area where the corruption has set in, and then cure it once it has healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc ad un home en la sua coyssa per que pausez aquela a eyssempli e adjutori sobre la tua operacio.	And I recommend to you that you enter into the patient's thigh to hold that in place, exemplifying and assisting with your operation.
Foc un home jove per etat entorn xxx ans, al qual accideys dolor en la sua cueyssa, e de las partidas dedintz mauguda es sobre la materia dedintz le cors entro que la materia es pervenguda a la cueyssa, e es materia de apostema am gran apostema, e no foc a lu causa extrinseca.	Focus on a young man around 30 years old who experiences pain in his thigh, and the source of the pain is a separation within the body, specifically within the muscle tissue of the leg, before it reaches the thigh, and it is due to a severe infection or abscess, not an external cause.
E adonc foc extendut le temps am aquela per la error dels metges entro que l’apostema es hubert, e acorrero de lu materias motas, e la sua curacio foc aprop pausada entro que la camba foc fistulada, e faytz son en lu motz orrificis les quals totz getavan poyredura e las humiditatz del cos.	And therefore, the duration of his suffering increases due to the error of the doctors, as the abscess becomes severe, and it causes hot, horrible ulcers on his body, all filled with pus and the humidity of the body.
E adonc le curec multitut de metges entorn dos ans, e no foc en aquels savia ma en la art, entro que yeu fu appelat.	And then a multitude of doctors have been studying this affliction for about two years, not focusing on the sap but on the art, as you have been called to do so.
E vi la camba de lu e las materias que corrian de lu aquels orrificis per gran cors; e ja le cos de aquel home era tot stabozit e la color de lu era citrina.	And he saw the hernia and the matter flowing from it through the entire body; and already the condition of that man was completely rigid, and the color of him was yellowish.
E adonc yeu intromesi la tenta ad un de aquels orrificis e pervenguec la tenta al os.	And then he inserted the probe into one of those hernias and succeeded in bringing the probe to the bone.
E aprop yeu e perscrutat tostz les orrificis e trobegui aquels pervenir a lor de totas partidas de la camba.	Then he carefully examined all the hernias and found those that were causing problems from every part of the hernia.
E adonc yeu me coytegui e inscidegui sobre un dels orrificis aquels entro que descrobegui una partida del os, e atrobegui aquel corromput, e ja era terros e corrumput e denigrat; e era ja corrumpuda una partida de la camba entro que havia penetrat entro a la mezola.	And then he carefully cut and incised over one of those hernias until he discovered a separation in the bone, and he found that part corrupted, and it was already hard and corrupted and degraded; and a part of the hernia had already penetrated and entered into the mesenteries.
E adon yeu serregui aquo que a mi era discubert e preparat del os descubert.	And then secure what I have discovered and prepared from the exposed bone.
E yeu cujegui que no fos en le os sino aquela corrupcio la qual abscidigui e serregui, e yeu ja havia derraziguada.	And I believed that it was not in the bone itself but that corruption which I had removed and secured, and I had already drained it.
E aprop pausegui la restauracio de la plagua am medicina consolidativas per lonc temps, e no es consolidada.	And I then paused the restoration of the illness with consolatory medicine for a long time, and it was not consolidated.
E aprop yeu iteregui e descubregui sobre le os segondament sobre le descubriment primier, e atrobegui continua corrupcio am le os.	And I then iterated and re-exposed the bone according to the initial discovery, and I found continued corruption in the bone.
E serregui aquo que a mi apares de aquela corrupcio, e aprop yeu fo perforsat fayre la curacio de lu e restauracio, e no es restaurat.	And I secured what appeared to me as that corruption, and then I had made it perforated in order to effect its cure and restoration, but it was not restored.

E no es necessaria iteracio en la operacio de lu e seccio de lu sino per la disposicio de la freulesa de lu e per la paucitat de la tollerancia de lu e paor de lu de mort, quar a lu accidia en totas horas per superfluitat de evacuacio sincopi mala. And thus it is healed by complete cure, and nothing is in place of the hard bone; its disposition in the body is well arranged and restores its virtue; it is guided according to its dispositions and does not cause contradiction in walking or harm in any way.
Mays si es os eminent en loc del cors ja trauquat, lahoras cove que tu secces aquel segon aquesta manieyra: e es que tu prenguas liament e strenh aquel en la extremitat de aquel os eminent, e comanda ad alcu que extenda aquel en sus; e pausa aquel liament de lana pus gros del primier liament; e aprop lia aquel sobre la carn que es dejos le os, e exten la extramitat de lu per que atires la carn a las partidas dejos, e tu descuebras la carn sobre le loc le qual voles serrar per que la serra no leda la carn.	But if there is a prominent bone in the body that causes trouble, then you should do this according to this method: take a strong ligature and tighten it at the end of that prominent bone, and ask someone to stretch it; make the second ligature slightly thicker than the first one; then bring it close to the flesh left over by the bone, and extend its tip so that you can pull the flesh away from the bones, and uncover the flesh in the place where you want to cut so that the saw does not damage the flesh.
E pausa fust o taula dejos le os decentment, quar quan tu fas aquo no es prohibida la serra que no secce la carn corrumpuda.	And place a stick or table beneath the bone, for when you do this, the saw is not hindered from cutting through the rotten flesh.
E cove que sia la serradura sobre le loc corrumput petit a petit, quar si es en la concavitat del os corrupcio e no appar en la sua apparicio al sentiment, e forssa a serratura de lu autra veguada.	And be careful that the sawing over the corrupt place is done little by little, because if the corruption is within the bone's concavity and does not appear in its sensation, it may require another cut.
E si le os es corrumput e no-eminent, abantz es la una partida continuada am la autra, e la corrupcio es al mieg loc o en partida de lu, lahoras tu descuebre la carn de totas partz tota; e aprop pausa fust dejos, e aprop serra aquel de la primiera partida la on es la corrupcio entro que sia continuada la serratura del autra partida.	If the bone is corrupt and not prominent, it is often a continuous break from one side to the other, and the corruption is in the middle or at a side, then you must expose the flesh from all parts; and place a stick beneath, and saw first the part with the initial break where the corruption has entered, until the other break is also exposed.
E sia la serradura segon le loc de la corrupcio un petit, segon que havem dit.	And the sawing should be according to the location of the corruption, as we have said.
E si la corrupcio es en la junctura, inscideys aquela junctura corrumpuda, e serra le os la on es continuat del autra part.	And if the corruption is in a joint, pierce that corrupted joint, and bind the bone where it continues from the other part.
E si de la corrupcio es en la continuacio de doas juncturas, lahoras no es en lu razio sino engen.	And if the corruption is in the continuation of two joints, then it is not in them according to reason but by contrivance.
E si la corrupcio es en le pecte de la ma o del pe, es mot dificil; empero cove que tu inquieras la corrupcio en qual manieyra appareys a tu, e que abradas aquela, e mondes aquela segon quascuna disposicio la qual es a tu possibla, e am cascum engen sia rectificat a tu, quan no fa a tu contrarietat vena o nervi.	And if the corruption is in the chest of the hand or foot, it is very difficult; nevertheless, you must inquire about the corruption and how it appears to you, open that up, and remove it according to any disposition possible for you, and in such a way that, when it does not cause you pain or affect nerves, it is rectified.
E sapias qual es inscididors e las serras a inscidir aquestz osses son motz segon le situament dels osses, e la preparacio de aquels, e la grosseza de aquels, e la subtilitat e la grandeza e la parvitat de aquels, e la duricia e la lor raritat; per que cove que tu prepares a tota specia de operacio estrument convenient ad aquela opperacio.	And you should know that there are various saws and chisels for cutting bones, depending on the position of the bones, their preparation, thickness or thinness, and rarity or hardness; so it is necessary for you to prepare a suitable instrument for every operation.
E sapias que aquela operacio significa a tu sobre la specia del strument del qual indigeysses; quan am tu es gran studi e lonc e conoyssensa de las manieyras de aquesta art, e testimoni de manieyras de malautias, quar lahoras ja tu las avias per tu meteys aquo que es convenient a lu dels sturmentz a tota malautia.	And you will know that this operation signifies to you regarding the kind of instrument of which you stand in need; since you have great study and long experience of the manners of this art, and are a witness to the ways of ill health, for when you have already tried these things on yourself, it is fitting for the instruments for every ill.
