De inscizio extremitatz e de la serratura dels osses.	Of the incision of the extremity and of the locking of the bones.
Las extremitatz se poyresso o per causa intrinseca o per causa extrinseca, o cum tu auras medicat aquela corrupcio per curacio de aquelas medicinas e la curacio no comfereys, o vezes la corrupcio anar deves le membre la qual no percuteys denguna causa, lahoras cove que tu inscidas aquel membre entro aquo la hon acossec la corrupcio, per que le malaute evasesca per aquo de mort o de malicia que es major defeliment del membre.	The extremities can be affected either by an intrinsic or extrinsic cause, and if the treatment you have administered for that corruption does not bring relief, or the corruption worsens to the point where it threatens the life or causes severe damage to the member, then you should incise that member within the area where the corruption is located, so as to expel the evil and prevent death or further harm to the member.
E le senhal de aquel al qual accideys, es que·l membre es fayt negre entro que sia cujat que foc la ja comburit, o se poyreys aprop la negror entro que la poyredura aquela ane entro aquel membre que siec lu e que prengua tot le cors; e donc coyta te am inscizio de aquel.	And the sign of that which happens is that the member becomes black where it has been wounded by fire, or you may find the darkness extending to the point where the ulcer has reached into that member which it affects and severs all the body; so make an incision there accordingly.
E semblantment si es causa de la corrupcio percussio de alcunas causas venenosas ayssi cum de scorpio mari o de vupera o de rutela e de semblantz.	And similarly, it is caused by the corruption and percussion of certain poisonous sources such as from a scorpion's sting or a viper's bite or a similar one.
E si la corrupcio o la percussio es en la extremitat del dit, lahoras tu inscideys le dit e no dones spazi a la corrupcio per que ane entro a la ma.	And if the corruption or percussion is in the extremity of the finger, you make an incision into the finger and do not give space to the corruption for it to spread into the hand.
E semblantment si accedeys a la ma, lahoras tu inscideys aquela de la razit del focil, e no dones spazi a la corrupcio entro que prengua en le focil del bras. E si envezeys aquel, lahoras inscideys le bras entro al coyde en la junctura.	And if you change your mind, you will incise the arm into the elbow at the joint.
E si passa otra la corrupcio e la vezes enviro le coyde, lahoras en aquel es la mort del malaute; e aministrar autra causa otra aquo en curacio es quantitat de vertut.	And if another corruption or change in the environment affects the elbow, it will be the patient's death; and to treat another cause of this with medicine is a matter of virtue.
E semblantment fay del pe quan corrupcio envezeys le dit del pe, lahoras tu inscideys aquel entro ad un dels nozes.	And similarly, if there is corruption in the foot, you will incise it into one of the joints.
E si pren en la pente del pe, lahoras tu inscideys tot le pe.	And if you take hold of the foot's edge, then you will incise the entire foot.
Mays si pueja entro al denol, lahoras tu inscideys la camba entro a la junctura del denol.	If it is possible to enter within the toe, then you will incise the leg into the joint of the toe.
E si la corrupcio ja es pervenguda sobre le denol, lahoras en lu no es engen sino dimissio, e layssar le malaute a la mort.	And if the corruption has already spread to the toe, then in it there is only dismissal, and you leave the patient to death.
E la manieyra de inscidir le membre o de serrar lu es que tu strenhas le liament en la partida pus dejos la qual voles inscidir, e strenh autre liament sobre le loc; e extenda le ministre un liament a las partidas dejos, e extenda le ministra autra liament en sus; e tu separa la carn la qual es entre dos liamentz ain spatum lat entro que sia descuberta tota la carn; e aprop sia inscidit o serrat.	And the method of cutting or severing a member is that you tighten the ligament at the part where you wish to cut, and tighten another ligament over the area; and the instrument extends a ligament to the parts left behind, and the minister extends another ligament on top of it; and you separate the flesh which is between two ligaments without causing a wide gap until all the flesh is exposed; and then it is cut or severed.
E cove que sia pausat drap de li de totas partidas per so que no toque le loc sa, e que vengua al malaute lesio ajustada e apostema caut.	And it should be covered with clean linen from all sides to prevent any contact with the wound, and so that the injury is aligned and dressed carefully.
Mays si accideys flux de sanc quan obras, lahoras tu cauteriza le loc coytadament, o pausa sus lu alcunas polveras restrenhentz le sanc; e aprop retorna a la tua medicacio entro que sia complida.	If bleeding occurs during the procedure, you should cauterize the area carefully, or apply some powders to restrict the flow of blood; and then return to your treatment until it is complete.
E aprop lia le membre plaguat am liament al u convenient, e cura aquel entro que sia sanat.	And then attach the affected member to a support at the appropriate level, and care for it until it is healed.
E yeu recomti a tu aquo que endevenc a un home en le sieu pe, aquest meteys accident le qual yeu e a tu recomtat, le qual es quar accidic a lu negror en le sieu pe am adustio que era asemblada a combustio de foc.	And I advise you to pay attention to a man on his foot, this illness that you and I have recommended, which is caused by the dark color appearing on his foot due to an adjustment that resembles the burning of fire.
E aquela corrupcio accidic primierament en le sieu dit entro que tendec tot le pe.	And that corruption is first caused in the deep tissues of the foot, which tend to affect the entire foot.
E adonc aquel home preparec per si meteys pus que vic la curacio anar al membre am la vehemencia de lu que atrobec de dolor e de adustrio de lu, e el inscidic aquel pe entro a la junctura, e foc sanat.	And then that man prepares himself for this illness by seeking treatment with poultices that the patient applies to the affected member, due to the severity of pain and the inflammation caused by it, and he cuts into the foot at the joint, and fire heals.
Lonc temps accidic a lu aquela meteyssa corrupcio en le dit de la ma indic.	For a long time, that illness caused corruption in the deep tissues of the foot indicated.
E adonc venc a mi, e so me perforsat repercutir aquela superfluitat am aquo que pausegui sobre la ma de las medicinas, aprop la mundificacio del cos de lu; e no es repercussa la superfluitat e comensec anar al autra dit entro que comensec en la ma.	And then it struck me, and I realized that I should perforate and draw off that excess fluid with something that would serve as a medicine, then apply purification to the body of the patient; and the excess does not recur, and we begin to move on to another deep tissue that we started with the foot.
E el apelec me a inscidir la ma de lu, e yeu no volgui far aquo sperant sobre la repercussio de aquela superfluitat, e mays que temegui deves la inscizio de la ma de lu mort, quar la vertut del malaute era sobre cazement.	And the physician applies the scalpel to the patient's hand, and you do not want to perform this operation hoping for the resolution of that superfluity, rather you must persist in the incision of the patient's dead hand, because the virtue of the illness was on the verge of resolving.
E pus que el se desperec de mi, es retornat en la sua terra e pervenguec a mi que aquel home preparec e inscidic la sua ma tota, e es sanat.	And since he has left me, he has returned to his land and convinced me that that man had prepared and incised his hand completely, and he is healed.
E no he adhuzida aquesta narracio sino per que sia adjutori sobre aquo que catz de aquesta malautia, e que sia significacio per la qual sia significada e segon la qual sia obrat.	And I have not related this story merely to provide aid regarding this illness, but also to explain its meaning and the way in which it should be understood.
De cura sinuum et qualitate clisterizationis cum medicinis.	On the cure of wounds and the quality of enema therapy with medications.
Quan accideys apostema en alcus membres carnozes e·l spazi de l’apostema es prolonguat entro que fa colleccio de sania, e aprop es romput e perforat, e es eyssida de lu la sania, e roman le loc vuoyt quays cum si era vayssel, e la codena que es desobre lu ayssi cum drap subtiliat, e no es pervengut a deriera corrupcio, e no inprimeys en le os o en nervi ni en liament, es apelat sinu, e no es nompnat fistula.	When an abscess occurs in some fleshy members and the space of the abscess is prolonged as far as it collects pus, and it subsequently ruptures and perforates, and the pus comes out of it, and the place left is hollowed out as if by a pipe, and the skin above it remains intact, and is not subject to further corruption, and does not press upon the bone or nerves or ligaments, it is called a sinus, and is not named a fistula.
Mays empero si le spazi es prolonguat entro que la corrupcio enprema en alcun membre, lahoras es appelada fistula e no zukem.	However, if the space is prolonged such that the corruption completely engulfs a member, it is then called a fistula and does not heal.
E la cura de lu es que inscidas aquela codena tota ayssi cum es revolvut, e majorment quan es subtiliada e es fayta cum drap, e comfizas que no adhereys al loc per la sua corrupcio.	And the treatment for it is that you cut that cord entirely as it is twisted, especially when it has become subtle and is made with a cloth, and ensure that it does not adhere to the area due to its corruption.
Mays si tu speras que la codena adheresca e que aquela corrupcio no aja conseguit per deriera consecucio, e en la codena ha spassitut de cara, lahoras tu cura aquel am clisteri.	If you hope that the cord will adhere and that that corruption does not succeed due to its last effect, and if the cord has passed through the skin, then treat it with a cleansing enema.
E es que consideras al sinu, e lahoras si es gran, e·l brac que yeys es de fetent odor, lahoras clisteriza aquel am medicament egipciac le qual es de oli e vi agre e ziniar recebent partidas enguals, e sian ajustadas en un vayssel, e sian coytas sobre le foc entro que’l medicament se fassa rog e pervengua a specitut de mel.	And it is that you consider the sinus, and if it is large, and the arm that it affects has a foul odor, then cleanse it with an Egyptian medicine made of oil and wine mixed equally, and placed in a vessel, and heated over fire until the medicine becomes hot and reaches the desired temperature.
E aprop tu pren de lu aquo que es necessari e dissolveys lu am aygua e mel; e clisteriza am aquel le sinu, e strenh le orrifici de lu, e layssa la medicina en lu per la quantitat de doas horas.	And then, take from him what is necessary and dissolve it in water and honey; wash out the affected sinus with it, tighten the openings of it, and leave the medicine in it for a period of two hours.
E aprop extratz aquela am sprecio; e fay aquo per tantz dias entro que sia mundificat le sinu e sia remauguda la pudor.	And then, remove that foul matter; do this for several days until the sinus is purified and the wound healed.
E alcunas veguadas es clisterizat am aygua de cendre, quan no es a tu prezent aquest medicament; e es que tu prenguas la cendra de vitz, e met sobre lu aygua; e aprop cola aquela e clisteriza aquel am ela entro que te confizes que·l sinu lahoras es ostat.	In some cases, enema with ash water can be used when this medicine is not available; take the ash of bones, put it in water, and then collect that and use it for enema within a period until you feel that the sinus has been cleared.
E si le malaute no ha tollerancia sobre le medicament egipciac ni l’aygua de la cendre, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aygua e mel e quays sia mesclat ziniar trissat, e clisteriza aquel am vi e mel mesclat, quar de proprietat de mel es que mondifique e lave, e le vi fa adherir le sinu, e majorment quan en le vi ha superfluitat de stipticitat e de siccitat.	If the patient does not tolerate Egyptian medicine or ash water, then use an enema with honey and water mixed with one-third of a finely ground herb (possibly a reference to a specific herbal mixture), for the honey has purifying and washing properties, and the water helps adhere to the sinus, especially when the water contains no excess of astringency or dryness.
E cum tu fas aquo alcunas veguadas e te comfizes que·l sinu ja es remaugut, lahoras clisteriza aquel am aquo que fa naysser la carn en lu.	And after you have done this several times and feel that the swelling has subsided, clean the area with warm water to remove the matter that causes the flesh to form there.
E es que prenguas de enguent dyafinicon e dissolveys aquel am oli rozat e vi stiptic; o que clisterizas aquel am alcunas medicinas e enguentz autres que hajan las proprietatz les quals ja he yeu scritz en le tractat dels enguents.	And indeed, you should take a solution of dyes and dissolve that oily matter and apply it as a sting; or clean the area with certain medicines in enemas, which I have already written about in the treatise on ointments.
E si le orrifici del sinu es streyt en le qual no es recebuda la canula del clisteri, lahoras tu le amplifique aquel am ferr petit a petit, e pausa en lu calgua envolopada en enguent egipciac o en enguent basilicon entro que sia amplificat. And if the orifice appears wide, then you should close it with stitches and leave it in such a position that the amount of liquid in the enema is increased.
E si le orrifici de lu del qual corr le brac es elevat a las partidas desus, lahoras secca aquel en le pus bas loc que es en lu per que le brac corra entro dejos, quar quan le brac es coartat en la preondeza de sinu la carn esser en lu engendrada.	And if the opening of the patient from which the arm exits is elevated above its parts, dry it in the lowest place on them so that the arm runs within them, because when the arm is compressed in the depth of the sinus, flesh will be generated inside.
E si no es a tu possible seccar le sinu entro al enviro del os pus bas segon que voles, lahoras te perforssa que prepares le membre am preparacio per la qual corr de lu le brac leugierament segon que es a tu apparelhat e que no sia en lu retengut alcuna causa del brac.	And if it is not possible to dry the sinus within the environment of the bone in the lowest place as you wish, then pierce that prepares the member so that the arm can run from it lightly according to what you have prepared and no cause for the compression of the arm remains.
E pren medicinas consolidativas que sian pausadas sobre le sinu convenientz ad aquo que vols exxten aquelas sobre drap de li.	And take consolidating medicines that are gently applied over the sinus according to what you want to extend, also applying them on a cloth from above.
E le drap sia de tan gran quantitat cum fa la comunicacio de tot le sinu; e aprop inscidey am las forfexs en le dreyt del orrifici del sinu un trauc pus ample un pauc que l’orrifici del sinu; e aprop exten sobre autre drap de li dels enguentz leons segon la quantitat del trauc, e pausa le sobre aquel per posicio longinqua del orrifici del sinu per que sia aleujat le eyssiment del brac de lu e no ostes le drap gran sino aprop alcus dyas una veguada.	And the cloth should be of such a large quantity that it covers the entire sinus; then, with scissors, cut along the right side of the opening of the sinus slightly wider than the opening itself; and extend over another cloth of linen the amount of lint according to the width of the opening, and place it over it at a distance from the opening of the sinus so that the discharge of the arm is prevented from it and the cloth does not remain large but should be changed every few days.
Mays aquel que es sobre le orrifici del sinu, le qual remauguas en tota hora per so que yesca aquo que es ajust en lu del brac.	He who is above the opening of the sinus, which purges at all times so as to draw out what is collected in it from the arm.
E per que sapias si aquo que corr de lu del brac es mot o pauc, o es digest, o es no-digest.	And so that you may know if what flows from the arm is much or little, or digested or undigested.

And when your treatment is prolonged in this manner, and you see the matter that has collected over the opening of the sinus has become adhered, or a strong adhesion has formed, on certain days you loosen it, and on the third day, after loosening the infection, change the bandage and renew the ointment.
Mays si del sinu aprop lon spazi yeys virus subtil, lahoras no te desperes de la adherencia de li, quar la sanacio de lu se apropria, quar so alcus homes en les quals tarda generacio de carn en las lors plaguas, e de aquels so en les quals es fayt le contrari de lu.	If it is a sinus that has created a narrow space with a subtle virus, do not be alarmed by the adhesion of it, for healing in it is its own, for it is from some men that flesh grows slowly in their wounds, and from others, the opposite occurs.

And if a blood clot in the vein is suddenly dislodged, you will know that the vein does not adhere; and if the adhesion of the vein persists and becomes prolonged, then adjust the treatment with drying medicines, since these medicines are moist in their nature and virtue, they become dry when added with oil.

And the last part of the treatment is to take drying oil mixed with rosin and apply it over the affected area, then wrap it with a cloth and continue the treatment until it is completely healed.

And it seems to work in the same way when there is no pain: apply drying oil mixed with myrrh and aloes, add frankincense, burn them all and reduce them to a powder over fire; then wrap this mixture on cloth and press it onto the affected vein; use the same method with honey that you have noticed to be thickened.

And if the inflammation persists and is not healed by this treatment, you will know that the corruption is in the flesh of the patient, and it has affected the bones or other hard members or their connections; then you treat it with fistular treatment, as it is said above.
De curacio de panarici et unguis attritae et incisione digiti additi et sectione.	On the treatment of pannarics (skin rashes), oozing wounds, and added incisions of the finger, and sectioning.
Panarici es apostema le qual nays dejos la ungla del dit pous de la ma o del pe, e fort leu nays en les autres ditz, e cum es prolonguat e la sua curacio es mens prezada, o es apostemat de apostema caut, o es corrumput, e gieta brac entro que corrodeys la razitz de la ungla, e fort leu corromp aquela tota, e fort leu perve la sua corrupcio al os entro que es a lu odor fetent, e es fayta la extremitat del dit lada, e la color de lu es fayta fusca.	Panarics are an apostema (skin condition) that begins with the nail of the finger or toe, and it strongly affects other digits, and as it progresses and its treatment is delayed, it becomes either a cauterized apostema or corrupted, and pus oozes within that corrodes the root of the nail, and it severely corrupts the entire nail, and its corruption reaches the bones within, causing a foul odor. The end of the affected finger takes on an extreme appearance, and its color turns dark.

E alcus de lu son natz en la razit de la junctura, o es la nativitat de lu en alcus nozes dels ditz.	And some of them originate in the inflammation of the joint, or it is their nature in certain parts of the body.
Mays aquel que es nat en alcus nozes del dit no se mau, e aquest que es nat en las juncturas fort leu es maugut.	He who is born into this world without knowledge of it will not suffer, but he who is born into strong joints is prone to pain.

De inscizio de vices, so son varicas.	Regarding the incision of veins, there are varicose veins.
Vices so son varicas, e so venas envolutas grossas plenas de superfluitatz melencolicas las quals veno en motz dels membres del cors, e le major adveniment de lor en las cambas, e majorment en las cambas dels itinerantz e dels laborantz e dels portantz. Mays la curacio de lor am ferr es segon dos manieyras: la una es que sia inscizas e sia atirat aquel sanc negre, e l’autra manieyra es que sia elevada la vena e sia extrayta tota.	The treatment for their fever is according to two manners: one is to make an incision and drain the black pus, and the other manner is that the vein is raised and all of it is extracted.
La seccio de lu es segon aquesta manieyra: embroca al comensament la camba am aygua cauda mot entro que le sanc gros sia resolvut, que es feculent de la camba, e aprop strenh la camba del malaute a la partida pus sobirana de la coyssa entro a la partida dejos del denol am una benda, e aprop secca la vena en un loc, o en dos, o en tres am seccio ampla, e aprop eleva le sanc negra am la tieua ma de la partida dejos de la camba entro en sus, e desus en jus, entro que del sanc sia yssida la quantitat que voles e que vezes habastar, e la qual tollera la vertut del malaute.	The incision is made in this manner: first, the leg is soaked in hot water until the thick pus is resolved, which is foul from the thigh, then tightly hold the patient's thigh to the upper part of the infected area with a bandage, and make an incision in one, two, or three places along the vein, widening it, and raise the black pus with the upper part of the leg, towards the area above, and below, until all the pus is drained, as much as you wish and as often as necessary, and this tolerates the strength of the illness.
E aprop lia aquela, e comanda a lu que abstengua de las viandas colera negra engendrantz.	Then close that one, and order the patient to avoid foods that cause black bile.

Maybe: "And their elevation is according to this manner: You who lift the patient's leg, if it is stiff and covered in hair, then immerse it in water and soak the leg with warm water until it becomes flexible and the veins are dilated; or if it is exercised through a strong workout, then do so without a bath until the member is heated.

Forma del inscident am le qual es seccada vit:	The form of the injury which is dried out:
Forma de unci orp:	The form of an ulcer:

De extraccio venae cruris.	Of the extraction of the vein of the thigh.
Aquesta vena es engendrada en las cambas en terras caudas ayssi cum al- Ategi en terra de Arabics e en las terras de India caudas e aridas de pauca teneritat e en las quals no nays erba ni aybre.	This vein is generated in the legs in hot regions, as well as in the fields of Arabia and in the rear lands of India, which are dry and have little vegetation, where there is neither grass nor open spaces.
